text: Came here because of the positive Yelp reviews and was not disappointed! The restaurant looks tiny from the outside and I was afraid we would have to wait to be seated but they have an entire back room as well as a little mini patio in the back. The food was okay and definitely fill and satisfied my Mexican food cravings but the real star of the night was the margs. They have half off margs Tues and Thursday so take advantage of that! You can get them iced or frozen (like a slushie) and with or without salt on the rim. They're also HUGE which is great for sharing or even for yourself.  I would come back for a good time with those margs.

Came here on a Tuesday for their $4 margaritas and they did not disappoint!! I did felt pressured to order a meal.... so I just ordered some quesadillas which were definitely better than something I'd make at home.  I would come back just for their margarita deal and chips and salsa.

This place is very cute. GREAT margs half off on Tuesdays and Thursday's! The food is solid as well. The front looks a bit small but they have a large back room and small patio as well. Servers are super friendly too. If your looking for a great date spot you really can't beat it!

This was the very first place I visited for Mexican food when I moved to the city.  Didn't know anything about it, just that it was a quick walk from my place.  Years later, we still come back here for the margaritas and the (secret menu) fish tacos.  Jorge and Augustin are wonderful guys who know how to take care of you!

I had been at Mayan Palace before, I was so excited to come in again and enjoy their Queso Fundido again. But, nothing went right this time. It's nothing worse than being served by a rude server and also she was not knowledgeable about their menu, our lunch was ruined by her today. Food was not even ok. Queso fundido not completely melted, and flour tortillas were sort of warm. I ordered chilaquiles with green sauce, they were the worse ones I have ever had in my life. Not coming back in the future.

This review is strictly for the wait staff. The lady who was our waitress wouldn't let us split the bill. I can understand if we had a huge party but the bill only needed split between 3 people. While asking her if we could split the bill, she rudely walked away before we could even finish talking and went immediately to a different table and completely ignored us until we put our card out to pay. The food was excellent but our waitress was absolutely rude for no reason.

I live close by and walked right in one night. The dining room was small with only around 10 table, so it wasn't busy, but I found the food very underwhelming.  The chips were very salty and the salsa was runny, so I didn't eat much of it. I'm usually the one to jump on free chips... The Queso Fundido was the MOST disappointing dish of the meal. The cheese has the taste, texture, and color of canned generic nacho cheeze sauce and didn't seem fresh at all. We couldn't even finish it.  I enjoyed the chorizo in the Chorizo Taco, but felt the corn tortilla was too soft, undercooked, and the shell broke in half. I did enjoy the tang of the Ceviche, the seafood was freshly chopped and covered in avocado (which is always good to see). The enchiladas were small, room temperature, and wrapped in the same corn tortillas as the taco, so they were flimsy and seemed undercooked. The flavors in the sauce were balanced, but overall, the dish wasn't that great. For the last dish, I had shrimp in a spicy sauce and it was too spicy to eat, so I took it home to try later, and found I could only eat a few pieces at a time.  Overall, I didn't enjoy much of my meal, so I won't be back.

They can keep two stars for their margarita deal but otherwise there is no reason to go there. We had their queso dip and it was the worst I have ever had at a "real" Mexican restaurant-they basically took a jar of Tostitos queso and put it in a bowl and microwaved it and served it up. It was really gross and fake tasting. Also didn't like their chips - really thick and too hard to bite into. Also tasted like grocery store tortilla chips. Also want to comment about the service. As I said my friend and I shared margs and queso and salsa. Well at one point in the evening (when we were on our second PITCHER of margs), I politely asked for more chips for the remaining salsa we had. The waiter rudely said "ok are you gonna order soon because I'm not just going to keep giving you chips." I totally was not trying to freeload-our bill was already $40 at that point! Made me feel super uncomfortable.

One of the best Mexican restaurants in a city full of great Mexican eateries. The food quality is consistently great (no surprise bad meals because of a different chef on duty), and the portions are gut-busting good.     What's brought me back to this place though, is the service. They're attentive without being bothersome, and will inquire about seconds without being pushy. After just one visit, we were regulars. They may not remember your name, but they'll remember you the next time you visit. We'll continue to come back again and again when we've got a hankering for Mexican food, or a food coma.

We ended up coming here for dinner after a long day of moving. We ordered a burrito and the chicken fajitas. The food was ok and the service was very attentive however I don't think I will be back. Good Mexican food seems to be hard to find in Chicago. My quest for a good sit down Mexican restaurant continues.

This place has the best steak tacos and great deals on margaritas! My favorite tacos in the area! Also, the queso dip is a great appetizer with endless chips!  The service is great and they are very kind! There is also a party room where you can make reservations!

Mayan Palace is my go to spot for solid food and strong drinks.  The other day I last minute changed a reservation from 20 people to 30 on a Saturday. Not only were they accommodating but our service was quick and everything handled well. The servers are super funny and make a boozy bday fun. Plus they have a front area that is quiet and back area where all the loud groups are. Definitely recommend.
Visited couple of times. Service is excellent, food is amazing. One of best Mexican restaurants ever.
Pretty good margaritas and good selection of vegetarian options. Food comes out super quick. Staff is also really really friendly. Small space so it fills up quick at dinner time.

I've been going here every year for my birthday for the last seven years. The food is so good, the service so personable, and the margaritas so deep that each member of my family has started to join in on the tradition! Truly, marvelous salsa, spectacular fajitas, and solid ambiance. One of my favorite restaurants in the city.

Disappointing experience on the infamous 1/2 price margarita night. My fiancée asked a waiter if the 'skinny' margaritas were part of the 1/2 price deal. We were told unequivocally 'yes, all margaritas are 1/2 price.' The bill came and it was $33 for 3 skinny margaritas. Our waiter (a different waiter - they seem to rotate them around) said they were not 1/2 price. I told him we were told by the other waiter (now nowhere around, conveniently) they were. He said to me "You come here often, right?" I thought he was going to say he'd take off one of the three margaritas, which I think would have been a fair make good for the misunderstanding especially for a lung time patron which they knew I was.  Instead, he said "you should know which margaritas are 1/2 price." Seriously? For saying that, let's just say he chipped in on the difference with his tip.  This place has decent food and you can't beat the margarita special nights as long as you don't order the wrong kind.  But they need to learn a thing or two about treating their long time customers!

This place is great-- when it comes to Margaritas, this is the spot! You can order a large pitcher of Margaritas AND NO ICE Into the pitcher which makes up much more to drink than you originally planned to and is also very affordable.  The food was great and the service was amazing. Sonia was very hospitable and even though it was close to closing they never made us feel rushed or awkward. They also send a delicious Guacamole for my husband and I which was complimentary from the house... I love it!
This place tries to push their overpriced margs on you.....chips taste pretty stale. Pepper to meat ratio w/ the fajitas is subpar.

I love this place and visit 1-2 times a week for 1/2 price margaritas. The staff here is fun and always welcoming. They made it a point to get to know us so we always have a blast there. My favorite margarita hands down is the Hibiscus on the rocks. They are delicious and strong. I also love the passion fruit! There a lots of flavors to choose from.  Have had the food there several times and it's yummy! We've had the tostadas, tacos, rice and beans, nachos, queso fundido and spinach mushroom quesadillas. All flavorful and delicious! Really enjoyed the spinach mushroom enchiladas. They came with a chipotle sauce on the side that was great with it. I have taken so many people here and we are never disappointed. Stop in and enjoy!

1/2 price margaritas on Tuesday & Thursday ($4 house) and a la carte tacos for $2.75. Domestic beers are $4. Great spot for a cheap dinner.  Be warned it's small inside, so don't come with a large group (They do have a party room for reservations).
Great service, very nice! Great food good margaritas nice ambiance I wanna come here more

Not that great. We go for the margaritas, ambience, and service, but the food is always lackluster. The chips appear to be from a bag and not made in house, the salsa is too spicy to even eat (and I am fine with hot salsa, but prefer a milder version for casual munching), the cheese sauce or "queso" tastes like it's from a can, and the main course food is subpar compared to other Mexican food establishments. We've been multiple times and every time we finish, we ask why we go back. Probably for the few reasons mentioned above, but if you want freshly made Mexican food vs store bought, this is not the place for you. We will be moving on from this place unless we only want margaritas.
Great staff! BEST margaritas in town...by far :)  Very easy to miss when driving so look out for it!!

Arrived at around 5pm on a Friday and were immediately seated. The waitstaff were friendly and pid attention to our small table without being overbearing. 2 meals and 3 margaritas later, we got our tab for around $50, not bad! Margarita flavors were plentiful and unique (pomegranate, pineapple, peach, mango, tamarindo, hibiscus, raspberry, strawberry, etc). Food was fresh and delicious. Tacos were huge portions. Spinach quesadillas were unique and delicious. Will be back!!

This is a smaller, casual Mexican restaurant. I had the taco dinner and a margarita. The food tastes good and the margaritas were strong. Overall decent place, sure you can find better Mexican around the city but this place is fine to stop in for a bite.
Best taco place. Very moist meat and very moist servers. Our tequila and micholada was amazing :) loved our experience go cubs :))
Great atmosphere and excellent food by any standards! 1/2 price margs during the week are a great deal!!

Really, really great Mexican food. I had a shrimp dish, and it was the best Mexican dish I've ever had- and I've had a lot of Mexican food. In addition, the service was fantastic and the portions are very generous. The restaurant was really loud, which isn't the business's fault, but the noise level was uncomfortable. I couldn't hear my date sitting right across from me. Overall, I definitely recommend Mayan Palace.

Tried this place after having troubles with another place. Was pleasantly surprised to find the food was above average and the drinks were cheap. We went during a Thursday margarita night, so it's a bit skewed. I wouldn't pay full price for the drinks but specials are great and in the right night you can get a killer deal on great food and cheap drinks.

Salsa is great! My husband who is not a big Mexican food aficionado is addicted to it and the chips.  (Salsa can vary in spiciness, day to day).     I regularly order the Margarita Gold and then I order one more!  In my opinion, they're very good and strong. Food is consistent!  My favorite dish is "combinacion 12" which is carne asada and chile relleno (best chile relleno I've had outside of homemade...not my house, but friend's).  My husband is all about the carne asada period!  Sometimes I'll get the chicken soup and that's amazing with if you cut the avocado in small pieces and eat....don't forget to squeeze that lime.  The chimichangas and enchiladas are okay.  But seriously Carne Asada or Combination 12 is where it's at! Service during the day has always been extremely attentive.  I usually go midday so I can't speak for what it's like in the evening.
the home made corn tortillas were fuego highly recomend this joint
If I could come here every Tuesday/Thursday and get these nachos and margaritas, I absolutely would. Mayan Palace is pure joy.

I don't know what possessed me to go to the Mayan Palace and order a taco salad for lunch, but I assure you it won't happen again. Slightly stale tortilla chips; indifferent salsa; and a strange salad -- iceberg lettuce on the bottom, and a congealed shell of overcooked steak and melted cheese on the top. I waited a long time for a diet coke; and even longer for the change when I paid the bill -- in fact, it never came, but I was so frustrated that I just left, letting them keep it.  I guess I see why the margaritas are popular.

Amazing !!!!!! The margs are really good... I like that they have specials on Tues and Thursday. Only downside is that the prices are way too high. Great regardless. I like to go here for dinner before walking to Blues on Halsted.

Decided to try this place out because I was in the area and Yelp said it was the closest Mexican restaurant. I'm giving it 3 stars because the food was meh and the service was not great.  I ordered the 2 taco shrimp dinner and 1 additional fish taco. The taco dinner plate comes with beans and rice. The beans on my dish were not hot or even really that warm. Same with the rice. I could tell these ingredients had been sitting out for a while The only that was warm was the meat. The shrimp was fine. The fish however tasted very... Fishy, if you know what I mean. It was not fresh and tasted like the bottom of the sea.  The service was just ok. It took too long to get our order started. Our waiter disappeared for such a long time that we had to call another waiter over, and he went and got him. Our waiter never stopped to ask how the food was or if we needed anything else. I had to stop him and ask him for a bottle of hot sauce.  Overall, the dinner was okay for a quick stop but I wouldn't go here again. Not sure why people hyped this place up on Yelp, the food is really not that good.

I truly would've given this place one star if it allowed me to. It would only allow me to give it two. I am truly not sure why everybody thinks this place is so great. The food tastes like it came out of a can or bag. The queso tasted like cheese whiz from a jar.  I will say the service was wonderful. The atmosphere is darling and the margaritas were good. I would recommend this place for drinks only. I love Mexican food and this place is steps from my apt so I was very disappointed. Eat somewhere else and then go here for drinks.

Came here for Cinco De Mayo and were seated relatively quickly around 6 PM with a group of 8 people. The margaritas pitcher seemed to get smaller in size with every order and our server seemed rush. I ordered the #1 Combination and the food was Meh. I really disliked the mole sauce on the enchilada. I'm also not a fan of double tortilla on tacos. The tostada was decent. We left after an hour or so and went to another bar down the street.

This is my favorite Mexican restaurant over all!! Amazing food and awesome staff. Chimichanga suiza is my favorite. They never disappoint me. Always the best choice for Mexican food!! Of course 5 stars !!

Came here for my birthday recently and had a really good experience. The waiter was so sweet and gave helpful suggestions.  The food was great, and fairly priced (especially for Chicago).  They also have a wide variety of margarita options and the two we tried were excellent. I do not think you could go wrong with any of the margaritas.

This place is the best.  We come here whenever we crave mexican food - so... every other week.  The salsa is spicy and margheritas are delicious, STRONG, and half off on Tuesdays and Thursdays.  Get the chili verde.  Also, Alberto is the man.

Based on the reviews, I thought this was going to be a delicious semi-authentic restaurant. It was not. Nothing was gut wrenchingly horrible, but nothing was very good. I had an order of queso to start and was surprised to learn it was orange liquid cheese in a bowl with tomatoes and jalapeños on top. It had a strong taste of Velveeta and no flavor at all. I had a couple bites and threw in the towel. I ordered the veggie taco and a tostada. Both were, again, very bland. The beans had an off taste to them - I'm not sure what made them taste so weird. The rice was good. It seemed like everyone at the tables around me was really enjoying their food. The service was fine. This was a very middle of the road restaurant - not good but not horrible. If you're coming here, expect a truly Tex-Mex style dinner complete with Velveeta and bland flavor.
Good service. Seems like a popular place. The food was enjoyable. Hard to go wrong with Mexican and tasty strong margaritas. I reccomend it!

Wonderful spicy salsa (if that's what you like) Guacamole was very tasty too and a fairly large portion.  The margaritas rock especially during the week when they have discounts.  The food is exactly the kind of tex-mex/Americanized Mexican food that hits the spot. You may have to wait a bit for a table but if you do it won't be long.
get a pitcher of skinny patron margaritas and the chicken enchiladas verdes!!

So I went here again recently with a large group. the food was quite a bit better. Idk maybe it was a one-time bad experience. I'm going to have to go here once as and give it one more go to really figure out what's going on.
Love the special priced margarita on Thursday nights.

Mayan Palace is awesome. You can't beat the half price margaritas on Tuesdays and Thursdays! The staff is very friendly and the atmosphere is always fun. We held a combined bachelor/bachelorette party at Mayan Palace with nearly 30 people and the service and food was great for such a large group!

We went in a group of 4 hoping for something authentic as the reviews had mentioned, but we were a bit disappointed. The nachos were pretty good, but the queso was pretty much ball game nacho cheese... which obviously is normally delish, but not at a Mexican restaurant!  The veggie enchiladas were ok... way too much spinach. overall, it was a pretty mediocre experience

Some of the best Mexican food I've ever had. Walked in and this place was empty, but I don't understand why. Delicious food. We got the chicken adobo, taco salad, and carne asada. Everyone was pleased and thought their food was amazing. Go here.

I don't know what kind of Mexican food others have had but this was definitely not that great. And I've had ALOT of Mexican food all over. They had a huge menu that's great for people looking for a variety of options but none of the items we got (queso appetizer, veggie enchiladas, chicken taquitos) was good. It lacked flavor and that authentic Mexican taste. The only tasty things we had was their house salsa and sangria. 2 extra stars b/c The service was excellent and very friendly staff. However, I would not recommend this place for authentic Mexican food.

Very happy to call Mayan Palace one of my solid go-to spots in my hood, especially on Tuesday's and Thursday's when their margaritas are $4.00! And they are actually really good!!!!! Not to bash any other restaurants on this review, but this place is a million times better than Las Fuentes that is down the street....  The service is friendly, and all of the food I've tried has been delicious. My boyfriend and I usually just go on a Tuesday or Thursday and max on margaritas and order nachos, which is quite huge and so good.
I love this place. They have $4 margaritas that taste like heaven. The Spanish rice is on fleek. Tacos are  bomb.com . Everything you could dream of from a Mexican Restaurant

On Tuesdays and Thursdays, this place is great--half-off margaritas, only $4. They're good. My favorite is the frozen pomegranate.  I usually get a veggie burrito dinner, which is pretty good and filling. The salsa they offer with the chips is great.  The decor leaves something to be desired, but it's definitely worth it for a late weekday dinner. Servers are really nice.

I really like coming here. The food is tasty and enjoyable. More importantly the place is lively and fun. They have a margarita special ($4/each) on Tuesdays and Thursday, and the margarita are actually strong. (I've so often gotten watered down margaritas of the kind you can drink 4 and wonder if there was a drop of alcohol in them.) So if you're just looking to unwind a bit, it's a good place to go!  The last time I went (on a weekday), the servers sang "happy birthday!" at THREE tables within 15 minutes. I thought that was a great representation of the celebratory ambiance the place can have if you're in a good mood.
Great service and fantastic food! Margaritas on the rocks are amazing. Food is great. Highly recommend the tampiquena. Augustin was great. Honest and attentive. Will definitely be back!

This has been our go-to Mexican spot since we moved around the corner 10+ years ago. Food is always solid, drinks are great, and service is always amazing. As regulars its always like walking into a friend's home. They shake your hand, pull out your chair, and remember your regular dishes. From the Pollo a la Mexicana to the Carne Asada, everything is always excellent. Its a true neighborhood spot so you always run into your neighbors and thankfully it doesn't attract a lot of tourists and suburbanites who flock to Sapori next door with their Groupons.

Smaller Mexican place in central Lincoln Park.  Mayan deserves 4 stars not because of anything spectacular they did, but because they did everything you would expect from a casual Mexican restaurant and the service/prices were good. To start with they have the standard selection of imported Mexican beers along with giant margaritas (and I mean giant). Complementary chips and salsa were on the better end, fresh and plentiful.  Also tried the guacamole, which didn't blow me away but was much better than average. Main dishes were large and well cooked, no absence of flavor, though the sides (rice, beans) could have used a bit of work.   All in all exactly what I expected based on what I paid for, without any of the often apparent corny pseudo-traditional atmosphere.  Staff was attentive and helpful, food was good, prices were reasonable.  I will definitely be back.

Was running errands in the area and between the heat and hunger popped in this joint for a quick lunch.  The salsa was amazing.  I got queso dip which was nothing special - will just stick to that awesome salsa the next time I go.  I had the Chimichanga Supreme which came with a green mole and fresh sliced avocado on top.  For the meat I got chicken which was perfectly cooked.  Chicken is a lot like fish where just a minute too long you dry it out and it is a waste, Mayan didn't fall into that trap. The meals are served with the usual sides of beans and rice which added nothing but between chips, salsa and a healthy sized chimichanga, you won't go away hungry.

This is my favorite Mexican food in the city!!! The food is fresh and delicious! Their margarita's are to die for! Tuesdays and Thursdays they have half price margs and they do not disappoint. The service is amazing, Flor is the best!! Keep up the fantastic food and service Mayan!!

My friends and I LOVE this place! It has become our weekly ritual to come to the Palace to get out Thursday Margs. Service here is beyond great, food...oh my GOSH, delicious! Margaritas are usually pretty consistent with flavor. I can't get enough of this place. Check this place out on a Tuesday or Thursday and it's always poppin!!!!!!!

Great food here and excellent service. We love to hit the large beer garden..that you would never know existed as you walk by this place...Been coming here for years, and keep coming back for the food and the drinks of course. Fresh guacamole is the best in the neighborhood The owner is onsite normally, and the service here is solid. Wait for a table in the garden area if you can..you won't regret it.
Simply the best. Best hidden secret in Chicago. My wife and I eat here at least once a week. She loves the tortilla soup and I usually get the steak chimichanga. The staff is so incredibly nice.

Disclaimer: we're from Texas, so we know both Mexican food and Tex-Mex pretty well. Obviously, there will be some bias.  Started off with the queso. It was obviously regular old ball park nacho cheese. So it was okay, but not real queso. We both got lime house margaritas as well, which were too sour but strong. The gf then got a red sangria, which was okay, but very strong.  For entrées, we got the Mayan enchiladas and the Diablo steak. Gf absolutely loved the enchiladas, which had potatoes and chorizo. Tasted too much like breakfast food to me. The Diablo steak was good, but not what I was expecting.  Overall, as our second foray into Chicago Mexican food it was a mild success. It was certainly better than our first attempt. I don't know if we'll be back for the food, but we may just be for strong half price margaritas on Tue/Thu.
My favorite Mexican restaurant in Chicago!! Consistently delicious, great service, great prices and everything is so fresh and tasty! I recommend this place to anyone who loves Mexican food!
I really like this place...great service and food! Never too busy. Oh and also the sangria is prime  definitely will be back!
Good food, friendly staff, Great margaritas, street parking and decently priced!

I don't know if Mayan Palace is great at anything, but it's good at a bunch...tried the burrito suiza with shredded beef, a round of the house chips and the frozen house margarita.  All above average, and the suiza was great, huge, and it came out lickety-split.  (The rice and beans served with it?  Total bust.  Just not very good!) The place was a madhouse for Cinco de Mayo this past Tuesday, but the ability of the staff to text those who are in the holding queue for a table is a big plus, and once we were seated, our server moved fast and brought a smile with each round of food. I won't be back to eat since I have great Mexican in my neck of the woods, but as a one-off, glad I checked it out!

This place is the bomb. A friend and I decided to get together here as I was craving some food and some cheap drinks. Naturally tacos and margaritas sounded like a solid combo and Mayan Palace is conveniently located off the Diversey stop. The interior leaves something to be desired since it was nothing fancy except for a bunch of tables lined up along both sides of the restaurant with the kitchen near the bar. For food, chips were instantly served up to the table alongside salsa. Great chips with plenty of jalapeno in the salsa.  Since none of the specials looked that appealing, I went with three a la carte tacos: steak, chicken, and shredded beef. Though nothing special, each one was enjoyable and quite large, being packed with meat, cheese, and sour cream. But damn you definitely don't come here for the food. The margaritas here are delicious and STRONG. Half way through the tasty passion fruit drink, I was feeling it. Good stuff! Though the waiter was kind for asking throughout the meal if I needed a refill, one drink was enough for me. Mayan Palace has got decent food but wonderful drinks. Come on a Tuesday or Thursday for 4.25 margs and since they have a patio I'll be back when the warm hits.
Decent food. Service was kind of awkward... ceviche before the beers came? Also food took longer than expected but tasted decent.

Yummy! Been here a couple of times and was lucky enough to be served by the same server as prior. He even remembered me :) I had the Fritas Dinner which came with a side of rice and beans and it was delicious! Love going here on Tuesdays and Thursdays for their half off margaritas. Some of my favorite flavors are the strawberry lime, raspberry, and the tamarindo flavor which was exceptionally good!
Dinner here was good but it wasn't great. I suspect the majority of the reviews are from people looking to get drunk.

I was quite disappointed. The food was average. The marguerites were very pricey and not much liquid for the price. The staff was not very attentive as we had to get up to ask for additional silverware and plates.They were not that busy to justify the neglect. They do not accommodate multiple checks for a group. There are probably better places in the area to try.

Worst nachos ever! I couldn't find the meat and yes I did order my nachos with MEAT.  When I did find the meat it was nasty. Chopped up in tiny little piece that I couldn't even taste it. Needless to say I didn't even eat half my order because it was just bad and had to throw it away. I will not be returning.

Came here on a Wednesday night and got margaritas and skirt stead with something on top that was recommended.  $60 pitcher of skinny margarita which was pretty good.  I felt like the server was trying way to hard to up sell but everything was great!  The ceviche was pretty good as well!  Would defiantly come back to this place when I'm craving mexican!

I come to Mayan Palace often and I have always received great service. It is my go to Mexican restaurant in Chicago and I love to bring my friends here. Their margs are surprisingly strong and are only $4 on Tuesdays and Thursdays!

Here we are once again, this time I give it 5 stars because the food was delicious and of course the service was great as always. Today our server was Alberto, he was very welcoming and attentive. The owner happened to be there also and prepared one of the best margaritas, according to my husband. I ordered carne asada which was cooked to perfection. My husband ordered a shrimp cocktail and we got ceviche as an appetizer. We were definitely satisfied with the taste of everything. Their food is definitely authentic.  This has become our new go-to spot for drinks and a good meal. I highly recommend. The waiters are extremely friendly and the food is delicious! -alma

The margaritas here are seriously the best in the city. They blend them up with fresh fruit. Do yourself a favor: come here on a Tuesday or a Thursday, the days when margarita pitchers are half off. Order the Guayaba margarita pitcher. If you don't know what Guayaba tastes like, be prepared to be blown away.
Best Mexican in Chicago. Try the pineapple margarita on the rocks and the chicken burrito supreme.

The food here is very mediocre in my opinion, although my friends seem to eat it up. I just moved from Texas where lard and oil are king, so my palette is not used to anything less. The tortilla chips that accompany the meal are cut too thick and hence not light or crispy, but rather rubbery chewy. I had mole here once, and it was just altogether not very good at all, and smothered on some very dry shredded chicken.  What makes up for the lackluster food is the variety and yumminess of the margaritas! You can get any flavor of margarita under the sun, and on the occasions that I've had the fruity frozen margaritas, it's been quite good. Alcohol content is not high, but the fresh fruitiness of it is great for a summer night. They also have a large open air party room and a small patio.

Solid Mexican food. Great service and strong margs. There guac is excellent and my favorite thing on the menu is the Steak Enchiladas Supreme. You really can't go wrong with anything here. We live close and regularly take advantage of the Thursday 1/2 marg special.
We got there at 1030 pm and even though they r supposed to be open until 11pm, they told us they were closed! What poor customer service!

Craving Mexican, my Yelp app steered me here.  There are better options elsewhere, my friends. Let's begin with the chips and salsa.  I enjoyed them, but the salsa was very spicy.  Too hot for my lady friend. I ordered the steak enchiladas.  Instead of nice juicy strips of steak, they were little Tic-Tac-sized steak pellets.  Disappointing.  I did enjoy the rice. I also went with a raspberry house margarita on the rocks.  It was delicious and filled with raspberry goodness... but it was also WARM.  I had to wait until the end of my meal to enjoy it once it had cooled down. I fear my first visit to Mayan Palace will be my last.

I live down the street and have been here many times. It has never let me down. Food is great, and on Tuesday and Thursday the margaritas are half price. I will say the margaritas are not the best I've had, but they do the trick!! The service is exceptional.
It would be a disservice to good ole mayan palace if I didn't give 5 stars.

I'm not sure why this place gets such great reviews. It's pretty average Mexican food.  The chips tasted like they came out of a bag at the grocery store, and were a little stale. The salsa tasted homemade, and was good and spicy.  Our server was nice and attentive. Flavored margarita tasted like it was lacking tequila. We split the combo fajitas, which was our favorite thing about the meal. The chicken and steak were quite tasty. Definitely enough for two people.  The cost was average for your run-of-the mill Mexican place. Just meh...overall. If I lived next door, I might be back.

I come here all the time after work.   They have great deals on Margaritas on Tuesdays/Thursdays.  That's basically the reason I come.  The food here OK, nothing too special.  I've had the chicken quesadillas a couple of times, and they are very greasy.  Also, the quesadillas are very plain, I have to order the "appetizer" version and spend extra money to add in chicken.  Otherwise, I'd get a plain chicken & cheese quesadilla, who wants that if you're over 12 years old? The chips & salsa however are VERY good.  The salsa is spicy, but not too spicy.  If I could just come here for chips, salsa, and margaritas that would be great.  Skip out on the food, it's nothing great unless you're starving.

I have been here so many times and I love it! I usually get the combo platter with the taco, tostada, and enchilada. I can't say that I'm a fan of the enchilada (or that I ever have room to even eat it) but the taco and tostada...amazing! Beans, amazing. Rice, amazing. Margaritas...delicious! They give you so much food for under $10. It's probably my favorite Mexican place in Lincoln Park.

I went to Mayan's Place yesterday for a little 5 de Mayo after work celebration. They were slammed and the dining room was really really loud, which of course is to be expected on said date.  I ordered the Jamaica Flower and a queso dip as an appetizer as I waited for boy to join me. The queso and margarita came promptly in spite of how busy the place was, and then everything went down hill from there.  The queso was topped with pico de gallo and when I attempted the first scoop I was met with a puddle of pico de gallo water right under the first layer. It was disgusting! I sent it back. The margarita was unbearably sweet! And I could not taste the tequila. It was worse than those margaritas in a bottle you get on a plane for five bucks.  For the entree we ordered the ceviche and the steak fajitas. The ceviche was clearly made with frozen seafood. I couldn't really tell what was shrimp and what was fish. It had this awful after taste that ice cubs get after being in the fridge for too long!  The fajitas were also a big let down. For $16 you get eight small pieces of chewy steak, 1/4 cup of canned refried beans, and 1/2 cup of bland rice.  Now, I wasn't expecting to be blown away. This was in fact a last minute choice. I was hoping at the very least to have decent texmex or a decent margarita. Not only was this place disappointing, it was really bad!  The reviews on these plays are pretty off.
I had lunch with a colleague.  The food was really good but the chips and salsa weren't that great.  I would definitely go back for dinner and margaritas.  The true test.

I came to Mayan Palace a couple of weeks ago with a good friend for dinner and many, many margaritas.  We started out with their chips, guacamole, and salsa and a small pitcher of margaritas, everything was pretty good. Our server was extremely patient with us as we were much more interested in sipping on our margs and noshing than on perusing the menu to make our dinner choices. He was never far from the table and consistently refilled our chips and our drinks. The guacamole was good and I really appreciated that their pitcher of margaritas did not have any ice in it - so many place fill those pitchers up with ice and give you nothing to drink! When we finally decided to order we each got a combo platter and they were your standard fare. The highlight of mine was the mole sauce on the enchilada. I had never had mole sauce and totally fell in love with it.  After our meals we decided to stick around for one more drink and ended up getting the raspberry margaritas. These were just OK and I would highly recommend sticking to the classic lime if you're trying a margarita here.  All in all I had a good experience at Mayan Palace and would recommend it to anyone looking for standard Mexican fare with a good service in Lincoln Park.

This is a always a good pick. It has a friendly waitstaff, decent food, and a independent feel. The portions are too big, so I would avoid getting an appetizer. Also, the take away boxes are styrofoam...not the most environmentally friendly choice. Tuesdays and Thursdays, half price house margaritas. They also have a cool back section when the weather is nice.

Since our experience was so good the first time, we decided to come for a friend's birthday party with a total of ten people. One friend was on time, checked in, and was seated. The rest of us came about 15 minutes late. We were seated and were told by the guest who arrived first that the server was extremely disrespectful and rolled his eyes at her. When he came over, he asked for the birthday girl, and began lecturing her about coming late and how he should have given the table away. He continued for about two minutes. We apologized and did have the friend come early to check in so that they new we were coming. There was absolutely no point in him lecturing us because they did not want us to move tables or leave. There were also many other open tables in the restaurant, so it was not a case of lack of seating. We almost left, but because we had a large party and we would not be able to find new reservations last minute, so we stayed. As a hostess at a very busy restaurant downtown, I understand that it is frustrating when parties come late. However, there is absolutely no reason or excuse for yelling at a customer on her birthday for being fifteen minutes late. The food is good, but not great, and there are too many mexican restaurants in the city of Chicago to eat again at a place with bad customer service.

I celebrated my birthday lunch at Mayan Palace was very pleased with the service, the margaritas and the surprise flan with a candle I received. Yay free dessert! First of all, I cannot say enough good things about the service. I wish I could give our server 10 stars. He was very friendly without being fake, interested in why we were there and how he could make our meal most enjoyable and even let me test my minimal Spanish skills on him. I took his suggestion on a vegetarian meal and was not disappointed. The margaritas were strong and delicious (I suggest the pineapple on the rocks!). They're admittedly overpriced, though. I was excited for our pitcher but when we received it, it was the mini version, not the full size I was expecting.  Had to dock a star because I REALLY love my margs and the price we paid for a little pitcher should have been the price of a really big pitcher. Food was also priced on the high side for being good but not great.

The place is a shithouse, not a palace. The wobbly tables are carefully arranged to make guests as uncomfortable as possible;  Mojita feels more like tap water with a mint leaf in it, and the waiter appeared either high, half drunk or just spaced out. One bright moment: the Chimmichanga actually tasted quite delicious, but with the surplus of Mexican restaurants in Chicago you have to do better than that to become something more than just a stopover for a few locals.

The best neighborhood Mexican spot. The staff is so friendly and accommodating, they're definitely a reason we keep coming back. Margaritas are excellent. Food is consistently good and at the right price too.

If there were a 4.5 star option, I would give it. Came here for an early Sunday evening dinner - the place wasn't crowded, but not empty either. Service was prompt, friendly, but not over-bearing.  The complimentary salsa is incredible - just enough spice. I had the enchiladas suizas (2 chicken, 1 cheese) and it was very very good. Husband had the chorizo chimichanga, and it was also very very good. The fried ice cream was good as well, but I probably wouldn't say it's a must-have at this restaurant. Price is fair...may be slightly on the high side. We live a few blocks from Arturos, Lazos, etc. and while the quality is way higher, so is the price. I guess you get what you pay for. For 2 beers, 2 entrees, and 1 dessert with a 20% tip we paid $50. Docked 1 star since my husband ordered the chimichanga with no tomatoes, and there were a few stray tomatoes in it, the fried ice cream was just A-OK, and the price was a bit higher than expected.

I thought this restaurant was good.  A lot of food for under $10 if you order one if their specials.  Atmosphere was clean and nice.  Did not have any alcoholic beverages do can't comment on the margaritas.

By looking at this place you would never guess they serve some of the best mexican in the city.  Their margs are incredible and decently priced and STRONG.  I think on thursdays they have half price margs too.  The food is amazing- I always get the taco salad with chicken and it is my favorite.  They refill chips and salsa constantly.  Gets pretty busy on the weekends/nights- the restaurant has a large backroom that is kind of hidden but great if you want to bring a big group.  Overall a great casual mexican place to go to for some of your favorite dishes prepared well for a decent price.

This place only gets better and better and better and...you get the idea. First of all, I love both traditional Mexican food and Americanized-Mexican food.  And I expect it to be awesome.  And I might demand an excellent margarita.  Or three.   Everything they serve at Mayan Palace is fresh and comes with a smile from one of the dependable staff.  These people know good food (i.e. no shitty Taco Bell-style tacos), and they are simply the best.  They remember your names, your previous visits/orders, and seem to genuinely care about their regulars...which we have become ever since our first visit.  The food is 100% reliably awesome.  Every.  Single.  Time. Thanks, Mayan Palace!

5 starts for the service here. We got immediate refills on chips and salsa without having to ask and before our bowls were even empty. Constant refills on water and our server was super courteous. 4 stars for the food. Better than all the other Mexican restaurants nearby on Halsted, but still just Mexican food. My tamales were awesome, rice and beans were pretty flavorful, and my boyfriends burrito was good too. Overall, worth the extra block walk past all those other restaurants.  I will be back.

Where do all of my friends go when we want good and plentiful margaritas and great Mexican food?  Why, Mayan Palace, of course!  The chips and salsa are high quality.  I always order the nachos as my entree since the appetizer is huge and more than filling.  The portions here are hefty and great value for the money.  Don't be fooled by the small interior.  There's also a larger restaurant area accessible via a narrow hallway.  The crowd here is always fun and boisterous.  Definitely not ideal for a quiet night out.   If you have a hankering for great Mexican food and margaritas, come on over.

Great find! I recommend the house margaritas and like the other reviews state, they are strong and delicious!! Half price o tuesdays and thursdays! For entrees, we had chorizo and chicken enchiladas and shrimp fajitas...well seasoned. Customer service was excellent too.
Good food, great service, fab margs... What else do you need to know? ;)

When I was in college, I'd frequent inexpensive Mexican restaurants with friends at least twice a month, but since I moved to Chicago, I haven't had much Tex-Mex. But after dinner tonight, Mayan Palace totally, completely satisfies my desire for tasty Tex-Mex. I hope to go back for veggie enchiladas more regularly! The lip-smacking margaritas are more potent than I expected. I wouldn't turn down a lime marg on the rocks, even when I should! ;)

Half Price Margarita Tuesday and Thursdays are my favorite. The staff is so friendly and inviting. Excellent and authentic Mexican food with an inexpensive menu. Lots of choices and they are willing to customize any order. This is by far my favorite place to eat Mexican.

Stumbled in here with a few friends to continue our night of great food, yummy drinks, and good vibes. The margaritas are so good! It truly is one of the best margaritas I have ever had in my life. I also ordered the two taco combo meal which was very appetizing. In regards to the service, I felt as if our waitress was a bit standoffish and rude. She made little effort to make us feel welcomed and made the atmosphere uncomfortable. Overall, it was a decent experience, and I'll probably return to try out the 1/2 off margarita night.
Nothing fancy or ground breaking here.  They just do what they do and they do it well.  PS: One marg will make your lips numb.  That's a guarantee.

1/2 off margaritas on tue & thurs... AND they are delicious... I think this review is over! LOL I came here several years ago with my fellow margarita enthusiast and have been going back ever since.  They have an indoor patio and more seating in the far back... i love it! I have been here with big and small parties... and never a fail! They even let you bring your own cake!  They have really good veggie nachos and their appetizers are GREAT!  Good for small and large parties, I totally recommend this place.  Also, it doesn't hurt that the servers know your name and treat you like family!  Love this place!

Decent decor, ok service, HIGH prices (for Mexican). Saving grace: great quality food. Average portions. Worth checking out once. Note: small "a la carte" menu, NO lunch plates & lengua(sp?) isn't an option.

A solid little Mexican place that I hit over the weekend with some friends.  They have a small outdoor area that is well done.  Magaritas are solid right off the menu without having to order anything else,  small pitchers brought out without ice in them.  They bring you glasses with ice.  Strong and decent tasting not too sugary.  Ask for a side of ice as well.  Food was solid, went with a Changa that was tasty, fresh and good sized.  Guacamole was decent but not as large as other restaurant I've been to.  Salsa on the table is pretty hot but flavorful.  I would return without question.

I always have high expectations of Mexican food in Chicago and this one was just so so. I was not a huge fan of the chips or salsa (tasted a little stale and didn't have much flavor). The food wasn't horrible but it wasn't great. I probably will not go back as I have other Mexican restaurants I love more.

We were looking for an alternative to the Saturday noon brunch offerings, so we went on yelp* to find some Mexican food, close by and not too expensive. Up came Mayan Palace- a ten minute drive from our condo.  Street parking was not turning over as quickly as we like, but we lucked out a few minutes later. We were welcomed by "Augustine" and shown to a table. He asked our names and introduced himself- not just to let us know who was serving us- but to let us know he cared about his customers. We did not want to be rude (that's my story and I sticking to it) so we ordered the house margaritas- lime standard w/salt for Hubby and pineapple for me. They were very good and reasonably priced for the area at $8.00 each. The guacamole was to die for but the chips could be either a bit fresher or made a bit lighter. Everything else was top notch.  Hubby had the chimichanga and he liked that it wasn't greasy. I had to steal a couple of the yummy potatoes from inside- I would like a side order of those alone! We both liked their refried beans- creamy, not pasty. I had the steak enchiladas suiza- delicious but the sauce was a bit "hot spicy" for me- next time I'll ask for a milder sauce.  The flan was very good and Hubby ate it in 4.5 seconds (ladies and gentleman, a new world's record) and my refried ice cream was very tasty. I like that they don't load it up with too much cinnamon and the coating wasn't greasy at all. Very nice with chocolate sauce and whipped cream. This may become a regular stop for brunch on the days I can't face another egg.
Foos is great and the staff is nice. Good drinks. The price is great and they are open for lunch.  They have a nice back room with good ambiance. Good date place.

Cute outdoor patio in the back, service was also great. 1/2 price margaritas on Tuesdays and Thursdays... and they are strong! Their salsa was nice and spicy and I had the Mayan Enchiladas (with contain chorizo and potatoes!) which were absolutely delicious. Another thing I noted was there is plenty of seating so this would be a great place to go with a big group. I'm definitely going back.

I totally dug this spot. It was on our list of places to stop while my girl and I were in town visiting friends....she's a big fan having lived nearby previously. I should mention that this isn't crazy authentic Mexican but it can stand on its own two feet and it's at least better than a Chi Chi's...for what it is, it's great! We grabbed a spot on their very small patio, right near the little Mayan looking fountain...shortly thereafter Flor, our server came to greet us. I'll be requesting her the next time we're here, she was phenomenal and she did a few shots with us which makes this place a fiesta in it's own right! The ambiance is fun and really chill as you'd expect and the staff was all really friendly. First, we started with a pitcher of margaritas and their guacamole...both were pretty fantastic. I'm fairly certain that the limes and lemons were freshly juiced and the guac was smooth and really tasty. The chips were a little underwhelming though. Honestly, after the second pitcher of margaritas it wouldn't matter what the food tasted like but it was still solid. I remember loving the tamale and my taco was pretty good too. I will caution you though, that the margarita pitchers are pricey to the tune of around $30 each, so be warned. Our group kept growing so we chalked up a pretty hefty bill when it was all said and done but I'd love to come back here for sure!
Really good chips and salsa. Delicious steak tacos. Margaritas are fantastic. The price is a little high for the quality but it doesn't bother me enough to stop going there.
I'm always pretty happy with this place - food is always good and consistent. Only complaint I have is that one time they ran out of Flautas. Whomp whomp.

Enticed by their 1/2 off margaritas on Tuesdays and Thursdays, I came in with a friend for dinner. We had no idea what to expect, but ended up with a great atmosphere along with delicious food and drinks.  When we came in around 6:30pm on a Thursday, the small restaurant was packed and there wasn't an open table in the house. A hostess immediately greeted us and told us it would be just a minute. In no time, we were seated and asked about drinks. We indulged in a small pitcher of their classic 1/2 off margarita (great deal!) We ordered the frozen mango flavor and it was delish! For dinner, my friend and I each tried their vegetarian burrito. While it wasn't the best I've had, it was a solid burrito in a restaurant with a fabulous, cozy, and fun vibe. The restaurant had a truly friendly and happy feel, which I loved. Wait staff was attentive and prices were very reasonable. I will definitely be back to enjoy their 1/2 margaritas again!!

Ok...just got back and have to give an update based on both service and margaritas .  They must just hired someone new which clearly isn't good for business!  I asked the new waiter for ice,  he tried to pour ice from a glass, that had been sitting on the table for I don't know how long. EWWW!   After paying for the bill he didn't ask if we wanted change, he simply tried to keep it.  If my friend didn't question him on it, he would had. Very unprofessional & sneaky thief!   I do want to add that the margaritas wasn't  good as usual.  However they was decent. I've been bringing new people here and they have been pleased.  However pay close attention to new staffers.  He was even texting on the floor.  OWNER!... your establishment is a "jewel".  I beseech/beg you, don't let nobody/anyone destroy what you have build up.  #TAKEHEED

Had the mole pablano chicken tamales  here, and they are a-okay. Nice earthy but sweet mole sauce. This small sit down place on Halsted is nice enough, but prices to me seemed a tad high for the offerings. Still, a-okay for Mexican if you're in the area.
The margaritas are 1/2 price on Tuesdays & Thursdays. The food and service are great!  Ask to sit in the back room.

I'm from California and this  place is a  joke.  1. Not to sound racist because I moved from a very diverse city(SF/SJ, CA), but the majority of the customers are white, so anything that has some sort of seasoning some will consider "good or GREAT OR AWESOME".  2nd. Who the fuk serves lettuce and tomatoes on enchiladas, this isn't fuk***ing Taco Bell??? 3rd. They don't have salsa or cilantro sauce for their tacos or chips, that just proves my pointing out the lack of authenticity. Nor do they serve carnitas(PORK for you midwesterners). 4th. If you're from the westcoast don't ever come here, the majority of mexican restaurants here have sterotypical names ie. BARRIO, MAYAN, ie... like really?? 5th. To make it simple if you enter an ethnic restaurant and the majority of customers are white. Just turn around.

Tasty salsa and chips. My margarita was small for it costing $8, and my food was nothing special, especially considering the price. Our waitress was good. Only accepts 2 credit cards per table, so have some plan for dealing with the check if in a group.
Great neighborhood place, the kids love it.  They seem to mix up take out orders a so I always check my bag before I leave, all in all it is the best mexican sit down place in the neighborhood.

I am a huge fan of Mayan Palace. So is my family! Whenever they come in to town, Mayan is always mentioned. Great authentic Mexican food. Their fundido is wonderful. Love their enchiladas too! You really can't go wrong here!

I was shopping in the area and had a hankerin' for some Mexican food. The enchiladas were great. I had some left over for dinner that night. The service was friendly and the atmosphere was comfortable. We were parked in the Home Depot lot because that's where we were shopping anyway, which was convenient.
Half price house margaritas on Tuesdays and Thursdays and the food was great. The party room in the back and the patio are really pretty.

This place was adorable! My friends from Chicago took my husband and I here when we visited last February. We went on a Saturday night and the place was packed. We only had to wait a few minutes and we got served drinks at the bar right away. The margaritas were amazing. The chips and salsa were free and plentiful (a must for me and Mexican restaurants) and the food was awesome.  The place was friendly and decently priced. If I was still living in Chicago, I would definitely return.

Had to downgrade the review for my last couple of visits. The staff has been kind of standoffish and a little rude to myself and my guests-- which is NOT a good thing. We are paying for your services! Please don't be rude :( Also, one of my friends found a hair in her torta when she was here. :/  (However, you still have delicious enchiladas and margaritas. But I have to downgrade a star because the service and the hair in the torta were kind of... meh)

I was in the neighborhood buying some gear at Guitar Center and thought I'd give them a shot. We were greeted and sat promptly and the staff for the most part was great although I think my waiter laughed at me when I didn't order a Margarita on a Sunday afternoon. Believe me they looked soo good I would have probably been there at dinner time if I got started. Anyway the Ceviche was amazing and fresh and my Steak Burrito Suizo was one of the best I've had and I eat a lot of Mexican food. Overall it was a great experience and I would go back the next time I'm out that way.

When this place is packed, prepare to shout at your own table to be herd, and last night was 90% full @ 930 - I thought the back room would be better to be away from the cold and smaller front room, but while it turned out to be bigger the noise level was higher.  Singing happy birthday @ 2 tables led to an all out boeing 747 @ full take off so my date and I sat there and waited until we could hear eachother's shouts after wheels up, yes it WAS that loud Virginia.... Otherwise the drinks are good size, I had a OO7 and it came in a large soda glass! The app was tasty and while it could use a few more vegggies it was enough to get us past the small basket of chips, but the salsa was good and the burn came on afterwards, so sweet to start and hotter slowly so it was a nice combo. Main dishes were good, Adobo for her and I had the veggie enchiladas, nothing spectaular but good average fair. Set your volume to max and your hearning aide will need fresh batteries but get past that and its worth a second visit.

It's a classic neighborhood Mexican restaurant with good food and very good service. We had a pitcher of the house margaritas, which I think were made with a mix, so I would pay the extra for the better stuff (although they are fairly pricey). Food is very reasonable and flavorful. If you want fancy, go to Topolo. If you want classic, flavorful Mexican enchiladas and flautas, you could do much worse.

The margaritas are 1/2 price ($4 by the glass/$18 pitchers) on Tuesdays & Thursdays, the chicken taco plate is $10 and the guac is good for midwest guacamole. I mean, really what more do you want? Is it anything particularly fancy/special? No, but this is a great little Mexican neighborhood joint that is a great place to grab a good, inexpensive bite.  (It is better than the neighboring places, i.e. Barrio, some place that starts w/ a T across the street, not to mention the taco/burrito places all up and down Halsted)  One of my fav places to have margarita nights!

My girlfriend really likes this place, we had to go to the Home Depot so we stopped by after that.  I find the food to be great but not excellent and the drinks to be as good as any place.  For the price, the food is great, the drinks great and the service was great.  My girlfriend really likes the super quesadillas grande and orders it every time.   The salsa could be spicier.

Mayan Palace is simply another faceless neighborhood Mexican joint, serving up exactly the same dull fare that every other similar place serves.  Serviceable enchiladas, burritos, and tacos which do the trick in terms of providing an inexpensive meal.  But they do nothing in terms of providing much flavor and certainly nothing in terms of creativity. The front room is pleasant enough, and the service is nice.  Beers are well priced.  Margaritas are overpriced at $12, and since they are the usual slop made with sour mix instead of lime juice they are to be avoided.  Nothing annoys me more than a drink made with sour mix - what a waste (here, or anywhere else that feels this is an appropriate ingredient for a cocktail). So, to sum up, Mayan Palace is a decent enough neighborhood place for standard Mexican fare.  Completely unimaginative and exactly like many other cookie cutter Mexican joints.  I won't walk more than a couple of blocks to get here though.

i really liked this place!  i was starving, and there it was, across the street, beckoning.   being a celiac, this is a tricky situation for me.  sometimes you're so hungry you might choose poorly in order to get yourself something yummy.  i don't want to take unnecessary risks that could make me sick for days to weeks.  so i figured i'd pop in, check out the menu, and go from there. this is a place w/ all the mexican basics - which is the kind of place i just happen to love.  you can get a plate of tacos with rice & beans for under $10, yum.  the chips are NOT gluten-free, nor is anything there that is fried safe for someone who can't eat gluten, because they only have one fryer.  however, my tacos were on corn tortillas rather than fried or flour. the service was super-friendly and prompt.  the place was cute and cozy.  my food was SO GOOD.  and i had no gluten reactions at any point later!  i'll definitely be back for more.  whee!

From the reviews, it seemed like the best day to come to the Mayan Place was on the days of its Margarita specials. Keeping that in mind, I did not have too high of expectations for the food they had to offer. Hell it was cold and raining outside and I did need a place to get some good hot food from.  And that's exactly what I got! A good hot set of Enchiladas! I really didn't have anything to complain about the place. Service was pretty good and the food tasted good. Again, I guess my pleasure levels were affected by the weather outside (disclaimer warning should have been made :o)  Sometimes, though you just want some hot enchiladas on a rainy day and nothing else.  Oh, before I forget...I did get fooled by the Mayan part of the restaurant name. There really isn't ANYTHING mayan about it if you ask me. I've had really good Mayan food in Louisville, Kentucky (I know right, but I'm not kidding) so I know what the exquisites taste like.

I had a  restaurant.com  certificate, so I gave it a try.  The food was quite good. I had a chicken chimichanga with salsa verde.  The chimichanga was not deep-fried, as I had expected, but it was flavorful.  My niece enjoyed her chicken nachos. The service was also good.  The server was friendly and helpful.
My favorite Mexican place! Make sure you try some of the "non-american" items. Like the chili verde! So amazing, and the service is fantastic.  That is all :)

Best and most affordable mexican in the city. Go on tuesdays & thursdays for half-price margaritas. I seriously go once a week. Great tacos, salsa, and a cozy atmosphere. Highly recommended if you're in the area.

Mayan Palace is in a really cute location on the corner in Lincoln Park. I went on a weeknight with a few friends. We were seated in the way back at a table very close to a window outside of which was another table on the patio. It was all the fun of eating outside with a lack of flies dive-bombing our food. It was pretty cool. There was a special on pitchers of margaritas that night; they were half off. So were single servings. Margaritas were had. I remember more about the drinks than I do about the food. I don't quite recall what everyone had, but I do remember the serving being so large that I had to take a box home and I ate off of it for a couple of days until I got tired of eating it. I think there was still some left over after that too. We had a bottomless basket of tortilla chips for the table, salsa, and maybe guac. Again...the margs make my memory of things a little cloudy. The server was very nice and attentive. The only complaint I have is regarding the strange puddles of liquid on the floor of the passageway between the front dining room and the back dining room. I don't know what it was, but it makes an already menacing looking hallway look even more treacherous. Other than that, this place is fantastic! I'll definitely be back.

I heard so many great things about this place so I decided to give it a try. I came over on a rainy Sat evening as me and my lady were hungry after doing some all day drinking. I heard the margaritas are the biz here, but we didn't do any because we had been drinking beer & champagne all day. We were taken down a narrow hallway to a separate dining area from the front main bar area. They brought us chips & salsa which were just ok. For my meal I got the enchiladas and my girl got the steak fajitas which made her sick. Sh was also upset that the fajitas did not come on a skillet. My enchiladas were ok as I have had much better. Im giving three stars because the staff was really nice. Not sure if I would come back as I was not impressed by the food.
I am a fan....they were half price and yummy. The service was friendly and prompt. Half price margaritas on Tuesdays and Thursdays. Do I really need to say anymore? Plus, they know me by name.

The food was bland. I barely finished what I ordered, and it was so bad I can't remember what's the name (some thing with mushroom and spinach). The best part of my food was the avocado. The drinks weren't cheap - a margarita was 8-10 bucks, although I heard they're good.  Service was ok. The main waitress/manager seemed annoyed at first, but turned out to be nice. Somehow she still scared me. Bottom line, I was uncomfortable.     I was really hoping to like this place, but after paying 24 bucks for a tasteless dish and a beer, I don't think I'll ever come back.

Took my girl here for our first date, now this is our go to spot for some good Mexican. The beans and rice are delicious! Love the Margaritas, especially on Tuesdays and Thursdays since they're half off. Nice cozy place with super friendly staff. I dig it!
Margs are fab, staff is better -- food is lack luster.

I love this cozy little Mexican joint and apparently everyone else does on Tuesdays and Thursdays when margaritas are half off.  But even with the crowds, Mayan Palace is my go-to Mexican.  Their food is delicious, the service is prompt and the drinks are sufficiently strong.  My only gripe is they're missing a Vegetarian Burrito.  There's one on the menu but it's not the standard kind you'd find at a hole-in-the-wall Mexican restaurant attached-to-a-motel in other parts of the Midwest.  The Veggie Enchiladas aren't too shabby and quite a great compromise.  This is one of my favorite place to bring friends, especially those who haven't found their "Mexican place" yet.

It's really strange and interesting how the restaurant is broken up into two sections: the small front section and the larger back section which is reachable by a long thin corridor. I think the back room is for larger parties. We had a very large party and I think the waiters were getting kind of frazzled because the food orders kept getting mixed up and they were barking random questions at us. Anyway, the main problem was the food. The grilled chicken was old and dried up, the bean/salsa flavors fell flat and it was altogether very disappointing Mexican food. I've had muchhhh better, even the food trucks have more punch.The guac was sadly bland, which is a sin. Only the margaritas were enjoyable, and I think they were virgin.  A kitschy Mexican place with not much to recommend. Pass.
Incredible food, recommended by the staff of Tony's Burritos on Belmont when I told them I was moving away from their establishment. Good call dudes...

There's really nothing like half price margaritas on Thursdays at Mayan Palace to really slap you in the face on Friday mornings. Damn you cheap tequila and overly sugarated margarita mix.  But somehow I keep on coming back for more...

Tuesday night. I dropped a Franklin enjoying some of the tastiest house margaritas.  Margaritas = Kryptonite. Sure the cuisine is not Rick Bayless---but if you came here expecting that I would question your sanity.  However, after a few delicious margaritas, you'll swear it's the perfect pairing. Make friends out on the patio.  They'll keep that drink full.  Try to keep track.

Stopped by on St. Patrick's Day because we were hungry and didn't know where else to go! Actually, it was very hot that day..plus drinking and hunger doesn't mix too well.  The place wasn't packed. It's a small restaurant with maybe 10 table tops.  It isn't a fancy restaurant, very casual atmosphere. Our server was attentive and noticed every time we needed more water. The food came out in a timely manner as well. We wanted to eat something light so we ordered nachos and a 2 carne asana taco dish that came with rice and beans. We were so full by the time we finished the nachos! The food portions are generous and worth the money you pay.

Mayan Palace is a fabulous restaurant. I went last year for my birthday and everyone had a wonderful time. The staff was very attentive and friendly. They had no problems with our group of 10-15 and our orders came quickly. The chips and salsa before dinner were delicious and the margaritas are to DIE for!  I definitely recommend this place for a great meal and a fun time. I am even considering going back again for this years birthday!

I went there my first time with a few of my friends and basically the food was very good, but OVERPRICED!!!  It's one of those types of restaurants that you would basically visit once a month, not weekly. I am happy with the food and service, but pricing is just not for me.

I made plans to meet a friend for dinner at the Mayan Palace.  I called Saturday afternoon for a same-day reservation and had no trouble at all, which was great.  When I arrived, I was directed down a long, narrow, creepy hallway.  I sort of felt like I was being sent to my death, because there's a dining room in front and the person who practically pushed me through the door into the hallway didn't offer any explanation and closed the door tightly behind me.  The hallway (or tunnel) did eventually lead to a secret dining room. Once I was certain I was going to live, I perused the menu and ordered margaritas for my companion (who was running late) and myself.  I am very partial to Cesar's margaritas, so I was prepared to be disappointed.  However, I was pleasantly surprised.  I ordered the Patron margarita, mango flavor.  It was very smooth and quite tasty, but for $12.50 I could have gotten twice the margarita at Cesar's. I ordered the chicken flautas, which were good but a touch overdone.  Not tooth-chipping hard, but a few seconds less in the deep fryer would have made them that much better.  The rice and beans had fantastic flavor!  My friend had a quesadilla that she seemed to enjoy.  We finished up by sharing the fried ice cream, which was pretty comparable to, say, Chi-Chi's (does that place still exist?).

Not sure where all these rave reviews are coming from. This was the most average Mexican restaurant I've ever been to. Not terrible but certainly not great. It was also pricey for what you get. Plus side our server was nice and attentive.

Frankly, I've very surprised of the consistently good reviews this place gets. The food was ok, the service was pretty good, but I didn't find anything about the restaurant very remarkable. I definitely don't see myself returning on my own.

I am going to keep it short and sweet.  The Mayan Palace is awesome.  I am not saying this food is literally passed down from Mayan Gods to my table, nor am I saying their drinks are the nectar of these Gods, but for real- this place is awesome.  Tuesdays and Thursays are half price margaritas, and its a great deal.  The food is the perfect compliment to their tasty liquid delights, and to top it all off the service is incredible.  I am not ashamed to say I am a regular, and they know me by name there- its a worthy accomplishment! So, go to Mayan, eat and drink up! Ask for Alberto or Augustine (GREAT servers)

Food is fine here but people really go on Tues/Thurs for the 1/2 price margaritas. They are good and they are strong considering that they're half price. Other than that, nothing really stands out about this place. 3.5 stars.

The Mayan Palace is your middle of the road Mexican joint.  Nothing fancy, but good Mexican food.  The place is set up really nice and decorated tastefully.  The staff is really friendly and makes you feel welcome.  The food is good and there is lots of it.  It's not the best Mexican place in the world, but it's good for a nice casual meal.

Great margaritas! We had the tamarind margaritas, and they were strong and delicious. But they are expensive, I guess the Tue and Thu half off special would be a great deal but we did not know about that before we went there. Would love to come here on Tue or Thu just for the margaritas.  I had the tacos (Veggie and Fish) - they were delicious and fresh made with great quality ingredients. The fish tacos are the bomb!!

Just moved to the city and was looking for a great Mexican restaurant to get dinner at. This place got great reviews so I decided to try it out. I ordered the Fiesta Chimichanga and it was so good! I was definitely pleased. The reviews also raved about the margaritas but my boyfriend wasn't too impressed. We both agreed they were too sweet, but some people do like them sweeter. Overall, I was really glad we went there, prices were not to0 bad especially for being in the city. The place is small but cozy. Also very friendly and attentive staff. You should try it out!

Its good but I don't understand the pricing!! I had a great evening here. I really did. Cozy little place, nice atmosphere. I was asking my friend if we should get a pitcher of their house margarita... and was totally stunned to hear that its $39 (5 glasses) for their cheapest option for a large pitcher while its $23 for a small one (3 glasses). Then I actually started to look at the menu and everything seemed so over-priced. Unhindered, we ordered a combo of enchilada, chile relleno n taco; Veggie enchilada and 4 tacos. The food was delicious, don't get me wrong but I just don't get the pricing.

Great margaritas-the raspberry was awesome! They seemed strong to me! Chicken was great as well as the chips and salsa. The chips were a little salty.The service is excellent. We were sat by the door which was drafty and as people left they offered to move us away from the door. At first I thought this was a very small restaurant and then I realized there is an additional dinning room off the side. Was a little more expensive than some Mexican restaurants in the area but overall was a fun time.

We love this place!  The food and the margaritas are delicious!  It's great for families with young kids too.   Tasty chips and salsa, yummy quacamole with onion. My husband loves the chorizo burrito and the strawberry margaritas on the rocks.  The kids (6 yrs and 2 yrs)  and I love the chicken quesadilla meal.  Make sure to ask for the quacamole on the side, otherwise they put it inside and then they're not as good to reheat as leftovers. The rice and beans are fresh and tasty.   I also really like the steak taco salad.  The steak tastes like fajita steak with grilled onions, chihuaha cheese, jalapenos, tomato and lettuce in a crispy taco bowl.  Not too big, just the right size so I don't feel like I've over eaten.  And the strawberry margaritas, on the rocks, are amazing!    We go to dinner earlier on the weekend so we can bring the kids and it won't be too crowded.

YES, MARGARITAS! So deliciously strong. They never disappoint, and honestly by the time you leave here you wouldn't remember anyway.  The food is good, there's tons of seating in the back, and the service is quick.  It's everything you want in a Mexican restaurant. Good Margs, Good Chips, Good Salsa. No fuss.

Best margarita special in the city! On tuesdays and thursdays all house margaritas are 1/2 price. This is great if you like a traditional lime and salt margarita like my husband or if you prefer a frozen tamarindo margarita like me. I've tried most of the flavors and I'm never disappointed.  The food is great, too. They have the best fish tacos I've had in Chicago. I've lived in Florida and So Cal so my standards for fish tacos are pretty high. The portions are huge, too. Everyone leaves with a nice buzz and a full belly. If you love margaritas and good Mexican food then check this place out. My only issue is that the dining room is kind of small. I wish they'd expand and open up a bigger bar area for people who just want drinks or a snack.

Two years ago I stumbled upon this place on new years eve which also happened to be half price margarita night (every tuesday, thursday). This coincidence turned out to be a recipe for pure awesomeness. I tried the house mango margarita and lime margarita which were both amazing for amazing prices. That night, I also had the best skirt steak in my entire life and I know my skirt steak like I know my chicago bears trivia. Cooked perfectly medium, it served as a perfect compliment to my increasingly tipsy state of mind. Since that fateful evening, I have been back multiple times to this place. Try to the Steak Diablo, the Skirt Steak, and also if you feel like a pork night, the carnitas. If you happen to be vegetarian, my girlfriend always gets the vegetarian enchiladas which I always steal one off her plate. A vegetarian dish passing the stringent requirements of a strict carnivore is always a good sign. Prices are very reasonable for the quality of food.  The only downside is having to sit in the back sometimes. I only complain since years and years of playing NES and now modern warfare 3 has dimmed my visual acuity so it's hard to see in such low light. However understand this is a common problem I have at many restaurants and other social establishments.  If you're looking for good mexican food with awesome margaritas, it doesn't get much better than this

I nth the margarita praise. And raise  mm.mm . good poblano mole enchiladas.  However, $14 for enchiladas?! ARE YOU SERIOUS?! Everyone else in the hood is $10-12. That's some serious overcharging y'all. serious.

Ahhh Mayan Palace - it's about time I review you! Fellow yelpers reading this - understand that this is some of the best Mexican food you will find short of Pilsen! Also if you happen to be in the mood for mexican on say a random tuesday or thursday - they do HALF PRICE margaritas - ALL DAY on these days!!! Want to try something unique? Their tamarind margaritas rock! and they also have strawberry, peach, pineapple, etc. Overall the staff is kind, the ambiance is spot on, and the food and drinks are delish. I've been all over and nothing compares - so if you haven't been here yet - make a plan and make it happen!
