It seems, however, that this place gets rave review for their margaritas.  Seated by the bar, I was able to watch them throw fresh fruit into blenders and whip up some pretty tasty looking frozen margaritas, which come in an array of flavors.  I didn't try one...but I was definitely tempted.   Thus the best use of this place is probaly to show up on half-price margarita night and take advantage of the free chips and salsa.  But nothing more.

What a deal! the half-price margarita on Tuesdays and Thursdays is quite good and strong enough to give my wife a quick buzz. Save even more with a $10 certificate on  restaurant.com  for as low as $1.20 with the coupon code. The taco salad is very good. Great spot near the Landmark Theater around the corner.

Having just moved to Chicago I have depended on yelp to generally guide my choices for where to eat.  Living in the center of the loop, I am at great opportunity to hope a train any direction to try new places.   Mayan Palace was great, a few notches higher than you average Tex-Mex 'authentic' stuff.  Service was quick and their margaritas are killer. I don't mind droppin a faire buck for good food, but this place definitely was well priced IMHO.

This is a great place to go with a big group of friends on Thursday nights for half-priced margaritas. The food is pretty good. There guacamole is fantastic. The ceviche is delicious. And the shrimp tacos are decent.  I don't know if I'd try to go here for a low key dinner, though. It gets pretty noisy, since the place is small and full of people. The servers are a little on the pushy side. I found the trick is to not make eye contact and they'll leave you alone.

I really enjoyed my Mayan Palace experience. Thanks to Yelp I gave this place a try. Otherwise I probably never would have. I am so picky about Mexican food so I always get really excited when I find a place that is above average.  We had reservations and were seated on the back patio which really isn't outdoors, and kind of reminds me of one of those party tents you can put up in your backyard. The service was great. It didn't seem as overly friendly and attentive as everyone mentions on here but they were definitely above average. No complaints there. I loved the chips (couldn't stop eating them!) and salsa and the guacamole appetizer was tasty and the portion size was very good. For the life of me I can't remember what I ordered for my entree but I know it was vegetarian and I know it was good. The best part however were the margaritas. I normally go for the standard lime with salt on the rocks but this time I decided to go for the frozen Jamaican flower margarita simply because I was curious. SO.GLAD.I.DID. I don't even know how to describe it but it was the perfect blend of sweet and tart and tequila. The waiter said it was similar to pomegranate and I can see the comparison. I'd go back just for those alone.

Solid Mexican food.  Affordable.  Great frosty drinks.   Super friendly and polite and quick waitstaff.  My only complaint is that we went here thinking their outdoor space really meant outdoors....instead you have to walk through a scary narrow gangway to a completely tented and covered (fully in the shade) area out back, that didn't make me feel like I was outside at all.  If they would just take that darn tarp off and lemme sit in the sun I would sip pina coladas there every Sunday.  I suppose if you are pale, concerned with skin cancer, or generally hate eating outdoors but want to feel a *little* outdoorsy then this is the perfect place for you.  Other than that, my burrito was scrum-diddly-umptious and I shall return for the food!

You know, if we were on a playground everyone would throw water balloons at me for saying this, but I'm underwhelmed by Mayan Palace. I went with my bf, my bff and my bff's bf (ha...have you stopped reading yet?) and we just didn't feel the love. The "outside seating" was a super-weird porch covered by this canvas and metal tent thing. It was kind of army mess hallish; I moved the group into the main part of the restaurant, which is a lot more appealing... chips and salsa were yum; no complaints there, but I didn't think the rest of the food was that incredible. I had the Mayan Palace enchiladas, thinking they sounded interesting and would be totally pimp, given their eponymous status. Bummer! Only OK, not terrible, not glorious either. Their rice is tasty, I have to give 'em that.  Bigger gripe: the "Half price Margarita Tuesday" hype is just that...like the pitchers are normally $35 bucks?? Boo, we got 2 pitchers and 4 meals and it ended up being around a hundred bones...for only-ok Mexican?!? hmmm, I think from now on, I'm sticking to the most glorious and tasty little BYO Mexi joint, Mamacita's. I even like Uncle Julio's on North Ave. more. Yummmmm.

My roommate and I were starving, and we wanted good Mexican food, but didn't want to drive all the over to La Pasadita.  She suggested heading over to Mayan Palace.  They served chips and salsa, so we munched along while trying to decide on dinner. I stuck with the tamales.  The rice and beans were so-so.  But the tamales were fairly dry, and the pork was really stringy.  It was a dry dish, which didn't sit well with me.  Most of the tamales I've enjoyed were soft, hot, and tender.  The one I was served was not.  My roommate enjoyed her meal, though. I hope to come back and try other dishes because I feel like mine was just an unlucky experience.  But it's cheap, so it wasn't like I was ripped off or anything either.

Count this as a 3 1/2 star rating. Julee M. and I came here on a Friday evening after seeing all the stellar Yelp reviews on the place.  We sat in the glass tent behind the restaurant.   I would give them 4 stars for service - the waiter was very friendly and attentive and seemed genuinely interested in how we liked everything.   I had a raspberry margarita and a Jamaican flower margarita.  If I ever go back it will be for the Jamaican flower margarita - very tasty and had a nice kick to it without making it a one-drink-drunk evening (such as can be had at El Jardin and is not necessarily a good thing).   Due to one of those annoying Libra moments of extreme indecision, I decided to stick to an entree I know and love, the burrito suizo.  It was HUGE and came topped with mole sauce that was really good - it had a smokier taste to it which gave the burrito a grilled taste.  The guacamole appetizer was nice - very creamy and plentiful.  I did not care much for the salsa, and the chips had a vaguely approaching stale texture to them. Overall I thought it was average.  I've definitely had better Mexican food, but I wouldn't complain if I found myself dining there again.  Especially after a few Jamaican flowers!

Mayan Palace is a consistently great restaurant.  I've been several times and always had quality Mexican food and delicious margaritas.  The servers go above and beyond to make sure everyone has full chips, margaritas and salsa.   I planned a big group dinner for 10 here on a Friday night and was not disappointed in how they handled our group.  We had a good time and everyone left full, tipsy and happy.   Oh and you cannot beat 1/2 price margaritas on Tuesday and Thursday!

the food here is pretty bad.  i had a chicken salad, and the chicken was pretty bland.  my friend had the shrimp enchiladas and was unimpressed. however, as others have said, the margaritas are great!  if you just want to get some cheap and delicious margaritas, i would definitely recommend this place

Three reasons why I give it five stars. 1. Food, of course. My chimichanga was hot, fresh, and made with high-quality shredded beef. The sides were great, as was the fresh pico de gallo, guacamole, and chipotle mayo sauce it came with. My girlfriend's veggie burrito was huge, fresh, and delicious (according to her)--and only $5.25. The salsa that came w/ the tortilla chips at the beginning was great, too. 2. Service. We went in on a Wednesday afternoon around 3:30--not a time when many waiters/waitresses are in the best and most attentive of moods--and our server was fantastic. He was happy, with a genuine smile, and very attentive. And our food came out really quickly. 3. Cost. Not an out and out steal of a deal, but really great Mexican food for a very reasonable price. With my chimichanga and my gf's veggie burrito, and just water, we got out for $14.50 before tax. Glad I listened to earlier reviewers. Yelp hit this one right on the head. I'd definitely go back.
I LOVE MAYAN PALACE. I ate here all the time in college, some of the best Mexican food I've had in my life, loved the big burritos after drunken college festivities.

The thing that really struck me about Mayan Palace was how friendly the staff was.  They were awesome!  Now for the other details worthy of a five-star review. Ambiance: warm and cozy. Margaritas: I love self-proclaimed superiority.  World's Greatest Margaritas, you say?  You go, Mayan Palace.  Confidence is sexy . . . even in a margarita. Salsa: Yum.  just the right amount of spice and not too chunky. Food:  I judge Mexican restaurants based on one of two dishes: flautas or enchiladas suizas.  I went suizas at Mayan Palace.  The ranchero sauce was a little different than other places.  It was smokier.  But spicy and very tasty.  The chicken was really nice white meat.  The rice and beans were not the best I've ever had, but with outstanding salsa and a pitcher of the world's best margaritas, who cares?  Nobody's perfect.  Except for me.

Cozy restaurant for great margaritas and in your face polite "can-we-help-you service"  The service: At one point I was wondering if they were joking, it was nutty how polite and able the staff was. Every person that comes into contact with you, introduces them self and asks if they can help. You almost want to tell them to freak off, but, they are being genuinely helpful.  It can be a bit too much for some. Decent food for the value. Many of their combo plates were priced around $10 -$15, with just enough food to fill your appetite.  Food was tasty but too bland for my taste and there's not much to say about their appetizers.   If in the area, I'd be back for a margarita or fried ice cream.  The restaurant is tiny, with alto of people traffic.  Reservations are needed, though if you are headed there after 8pm it shouldn't be a problem.  However the later your schedule, the harder it is to find parking.

Mayan Palace claims to have "the best margaritas in the world"... While that seems a little far-fetched, I must admit they are pretty good. In fact, their most expensive margarita is made with top-shelf tequila, costs only $9 and comes in a giant glass... now that's what I like. Expect to be hammered after about two of those. Now about the food, it's pretty good but not outstanding. I ordered the pork tamales, and they were pretty tasty. My boyfriend got the grilled shrimp, also tasty. So no complaints, but it's not the best Mexican I've had (still better than most places in NYC, but that's not saying much).  I have to mention however that the service was extremely friendly... almost so friendly that it was kind of weird. Seriously, we had three waiters taking care of us, and each of them would come by every few minutes to check on us. I'm not complaining... just noting. I'd probably go back if in the neighborhood and craving Mexican, but I probably wouldn't go too much out of my way. 3-1/2 stars.

Hands down the best Mexican restaurant EVER. They treat regulars like royalty and are incredibly reasonably priced. We're having our rehearsal dinner there and Rudy is extremely flexible and wonderful to work with!!

Don't be alarmed if the waiter sends you through a door that will have you wondering if you are about to be chopped into a million little pieces. This is actually the VIP door and it will lead you through an insanely narrow passageway to a heated back porch.  I made reservations here without having gone before (I like to live on the edge) and had a really positive experience. With a group of 13, I'm sure we were insanely loud, but out servers were super attentive and VERY accommodating to any needs that came up. While I didn't try a margarita, I thought my mojito was delicious (and subsequently had a few more).  Our appetizers were really good -- we had both the spinach quesadillas and some quacamole -- and everyone (to my knowledge) enjoyed their main course.  I would definitely come back!

I am shocked. SHOCKED this place has positive reviews... though in a way not.  It seemed like everyone there was a repeat customer who knew the staff by name.... However, I am not sure exactly why.  Everyone there was white, btw.  This may seem silly, but I don't trust a Mexican place in the city that cannot attract a single Mexican.  I got there and after a couple minutes, they brought me an ordered sangria (WAY overpriced) tons of ice, tasting of vinegar, no fruit then....  I sat, menu closed, for 13 minutes while the staff (more staff than customers) talked LOUDLY. So loudly it was disturbing.  When the waiter FINALLY Comes over I inform him I am ready to order and he says "Already?" like he can play some Jedi mind trick and make me think I was not already there 20 minutes.     I order combination #3; Cheese enchilada, veggie taco, chile rellano. First of all, the veggie taco was all barely warm green peppers and onions with a scant scattering of cheese and a light dollop of sour cream.  Not terrible, just bland and disappointing.  The rest was so salty I thought I would die of hypertension right there.  This was ridiculous.  I live in a neighborhood with a ton of great Mexican food; this is not even decent Mexican food.  I swear they oversalt so you drink a lot.  They asked me if I wanted a drink about eight more times. The enchilada sauce was VERY salty AND sugary, like a BBQ sauce with taco seasoning. It was also cold.  Beans and rice were so salty they had no other flavor.  The chile rellano had some sort of sauce on it that tasted just like Ragu brand sauce with some onions (and salt) mixed in.  Just awful.  This is easily the worst Mexican I have ever had; I ate better in both Fargo North Dakota and middle of nowhere Northern Minnesota.  What was good? The mango margarita.  I cannot think of a reason to touch their actual feed.   Two stars b.. actually, screw it. One star. It was not cheap either.

I love this place! My friends & I found this place by accident.  We were sick of waiting in lines to get into a bar on St. Patty's Day and well this place was right next door and no one was in there.  We've been going back ever since.  The wait staff are so friendly!! You have 3 people taking care of you and they remember you every time you go back.  Their food is delicious.  I'm a big fan of their chimichanga's  and their pineapple margaritas.  I love Tuesday & Thursday's there because their marges are half off!! Definitely have to get there early on those days because the place is packed! I've read reviews on how pricey this place is.  I think its reasonable priced!  Its cheaper then Tarasca's or Uncle Julios for sure!

I highly recommend half-price margarita night, but get there before 8pm cuz the place fills up quick.  Of course, if you come here right after work, you're not going to want to leave until after midnight, and that's sort of a problem if you have to be at work again on Wednesday.

The food is great and the service is probably the friendliest in the city. Strong margaritas and they cut their carne asada thick not the paper thin cuts you normally get. If you like your salsa to have a kick ask for the green salsa.

I am extremely picky when it comes to my margaritas, and when I first went to Mayan Palace, I wasn't expecting much. I was pleasantly surprised to say the least. They were delicious! Plus, they are half price on Tuesdays and Thursdays! Oh, and the food is great as well! Definitely one of my fav restaurants in the neighborhood!

I will never go to another Mexican place in Chicago again., well, at least not sober. It was a Thursday night and I felt like eating enchiladas. So, I came onto yelp, typed in enchiladas or something, and wala, I was given Mayan Palace. And the reviews said they had half-priced margaritas on Tuesday and Thursday nights.  Awesome. So my girlfriend and I hopped in a cab and mosey'ed our asses over here. It's a quiet little joint, and it was jam-packed, as in, to the point that the line extends out the front door. There was also a midget standing on someone's shoulders downing a pitcher of lemon margarita. We're standing there, thinking, "Fuck, we're not going to get a seat for like an hour." and the lady says "Fifteen minutes." Awesome. We grab a margarita, and maybe ten minutes later, we've got seats. There's chips on salsa and two glasses of water already on the table when we're seated. Awesome. And, now is when it gets good. The service is amazing. Beyond amazing. You don't have one specific server for your table; the entire crew is there to server you. Within seconds of a glass of water, or a margarita, or the salsa being emptied, a server will ask if you want a refill. Within seconds of him leaving, and a different server noticing that you are empty, they will ask if you need a refill. This is even though there was -no- standing room in the restaurant and it was busy as all hell. In addition, they did this while having a massive smile on their faces. Now the bonus: A week and a half later, we went back, and the server recognized us, remembered where we were sitting the time before and commented on it. (We were in their covered, heated outdoor patio which was just slightly colder than their normal inside room.) Once again, we wouldn't go 3.4 seconds having an empty glass, cup, or basket of chips without an offer for a refill. This place is amazing. The service alone makes you want to eat here. The margaritas aren't amazing, but they're good. Get the lemon margarita. The guacamole appetizer is amazing, probably the best I've ever had. The ceviche looked good, but I haven't eaten it. (One old Mexican dude next to me ate two of them himself, and it's going on my plate next time.) The rest of the food is good too. Lastly, this is the -only- Mexican food I have ever had which has not caused my ass to explode, and for that, I will only go here ... assuming I am sober of course.

Killer strawberry margaritas at this place!  I ordered cheese  quesadillas and enjoyed every bite of them.  The service is above average too.  Our waiter was very attentive and friendly.  We didn't have to wait long for anything and it was a busy Wednesday evening. One of my new favorite places.

Our only requirements when looking for a new spot for Mexican were that they have strong margaritas, and something cheesy.  We got that, and little more here.  I was surprised at how crowded it was, and how undelicious (and pricey) our food was, even after downing a pitcher of margs at the bar while waiting for a table.

This place is one of my favorite Mexican places in the city.  It is very reasonably priced, they have great food and the drink specials are fantastic (half priced margaritas FTW!).   There are only a few problems.  It can get very cramped inside the restaurant (the patio is awesome though) because of how small it is.  Also, the food is REALLY heavy.  Don't plan on doing anything for at least two hours after you eat.  This place should really be reserved for nights that you are just going to do dinner and go home and sleep.  The food is that heavy.
amazing! order off the ala carte menu and you've got a decently portioned meal with a 1/2 price margarita on tues/thurs!

I am a tough customer when it comes to Mexican food...chalk it up to living in California for 7 years.  This is very, very good Mex.  Let's start with the salsa--it definitely has a spicy kick.  The burritos are so yummy (and cheap!)  And now...on to the important stuff...the margaritas.  They are SO strong.  They will make your toes curl and blow your hair back.  The atmosphere is cozy and the service is great.  Definitely check it out.

Extremely small, quaint Mexican joint that has killer margaritas on Thursday evenings (get there early for a table).  The staff is extremely friendly as well.  The food is average Mexican, I would say a bit over priced compared to what you would find in Pilsen due to quality--but this is Lake View.  The tamales are some of the best I've ever had and would make a good snack (even though Mexican tamales have nothing on Central/South American tamales).

Compared to the cheaper taco joints, Mayan Palace is better for a sit down meal with friends or before a night out.  Slightly more expensive, but well worth it.  Try the (lime) margaritas - they are strong and good.

Really good food - even better service. I ordered the fajitas, gf ordered the chimichunga  - both were fantastic.  The service was fast and not in your face. I attempted to order a margarita, however, I could only understand 'two hours' from the server - even though two tables around us had marg's. Im not sure what that meant. Anyways, if you like the mexi - this place is sure to satisfy your needs.
Great food. Great service.  Check it out if you like authentic Mexican.

This place used to be awesome before everyone found out about the 1/2 price margarita Thursdays and went there.  The food is just OK, it has gotten spicier over the years and they raised their prices.  Margaritas are pretty good, but not nearly as good as other finer establishments like El Cid or Garcia's.  Every Lincoln Parker loves it so they can get drunk, but that's what MP does well....gets yuppies and college kids drunk for relatively cheap.

Jamaican Flower?  What the heck is that?  Well, I'm still not really sure but I can tell you the Jamaican Flower margarita here is excellent.  Along with the mango, raspberry... you get my drift.  Tuesdays and Thursdays are half-price margaritas and man are they yummy.  The food and service are good too.  The only problem is that the restaurant is very small so I highly recommend making reservations.

I have to admit, Mexican food is not usually my first choice when I eat out.  But, when I am in the mood for it, this is the place I go.  The food is great, and reasonably priced.  And the drinks--I don't think I've been to a place with more margarita choices... lime, mango, peach, raspberry, strawberry, tamarind, jamaica flower, and banana.  I haven't tried them all, but the ones that I have are great!  Fruity, but very strong--absolutely perfect.

By far the most amazing mexican restaurant in Chicago! Here are five reasons you need to experience this place for yourself: 1.  Alejandro is a fantastic server, who remembers you each time you visit, and seems genuinely happy to see you.  His sidekicks are on top of their game as well! 2.  Their selection of margarita flavors is great, and they are all delicious!  My favorite is the strawberry mango.  There are actually chunks of mango in it! 3.  The chimichangas and guacamole are unbelievable! 4.  It's affordable! 5.  When it's warm outside, the back patio is nice.  It's not much to look at, and the walkway leading you there is between two brick buildings that may be about a foot apart, but once there, it's worth it! I can never get enough of Mayan Palace!

Everyone who knows me knows that when I want carne asada, I head to Cesar's (home of the "Killer Margarita") on Clark. My absolute favorite. And yes, their margaritas are killer because they are fueled by what you put in your gas tank. And they taste that way, too, which is why I always I opt for a low-cal alternative, the pina colada. But this is a review for Mayan Palace--which is giving Cesar's a run for its money with their carne asada. And the margaritas are absolutely EXCELLENT. I only tried their basic house margarita, so no fancy flavorings or top-shelf tequila. But whatever they do to it, they do it just right. I don't drink margaritas often, because, often, they are mediocre. If this is your gripe, or if you are tired of settling for less-than-the-best, go to Mayan Palace. You will not be disappointed. Have it with a steak--it comes w/grilled onions and guacamole. What more do you need?
Ahhh I used to go here all the time when I lived down the street.  I miss you, Mayan Palace margarita man who gave us frozen margaritas to go for the pride parade.

This place was great--small and quaint, but not too small or kitschy... The service was great.  Our waiter was very friendly and I was never without water (which is saying something, as I usually go through several glasses of water). The food was really good and reasonably priced.  I had a combination platter, which included a tostada (I chose chicken, and it was really good), a taco (I chose beef, and it was also really good), and a cheese enchilada.   Definitely a solid choice--I would definitely go back.   Overall, a pleasant experience.

I didn't eat a whole lot of food here...just a tun of margaritas. actually i had more of the tequila y sprite (or was it 7 up? ..not sure, some white soda but not fresco).   the queso fundido was OK.  about 1/2 as good as frontera's, but probably 3x as much food for the same price.  actually that's pretty much my assessment of the whole place...  the drinks weren't terribly great, though actually made with real juices and not from a mix. ceviche was decent. the mojitos didn't taste all that real, like they were from that mint liquor mix... but those aren't mexican anyway. i've heard the back patio is nice too!

Bless you, Good Yelpers; you've not yet let me down. I met a friend at Mayan Palace last night, and we were both shocked at how good it was, despite all the raving reviews we'd read beforehand. The staff is warm and friendly, even when they have to fight through a crowd of people waiting for tables at the bar. Two men greeted me at the door and told me it'd be about 20 minutes before we got a table, and within 10 minutes, we had fresh margaritas from the bar (omg BANANA) and were seated at our table. My friend and I split the queso fundido, which was dripping with healthy deliciousness and served with piping hot tortillas, followed by my chicken enchiladas suizas and her combo platter. I can't speak to hers--and it was so smothered with food from edge to edge that I couldn't even tell you what all was on it--but my enchiladas were good.  And I say only good because the sauce tasted more than a little like barbecue sauce (there goes that star), which I can respect as a Kansas City native, but not in my Mexican food, please and thank-you. Charming dcor, great food and service that never suffered at the demands of a HUGE weeknight crowd earn Mayan Palace four happy stars from me!

This is my neighborhood standby whenever I can't think of where to go for dinner.  The food is delicious and the ingredients seem to be a bit higher quality than many comparable Mexican restaurants.  While everything I've had is tasty, I highly recommend the Mar y Tierra - a surf n' turf with incredibly seasoned skirt steak and tequila lime shrimp.  If given a choice, I usually prefer the corn tortillas over the flour ones. As other reviewers have mentioned, the service at Mayan Palace is great and the staff are extremely friendly.  There is not a lot of space in the restaurant, and the tables can feel a bit cramped.  It can get especially crowded on Tuesdays and Thursdays for half-price house margaritas.  In the summer they open the back patio which provides a ton more seating, even if it feels like you're eating in someone's backyard.  This is definitely a place to go for the food and friendliness, not necessarily ambiance.

Great Mexican food. Absolutely great. And the service was quick and very friendly - she just kept those Coronas and the guacamole coming! Not too pricey. The only thing I would say is that there isn't a whole lot of space. Reservations are definitely necessary because there aren't very many tables. I went with a group of 7 or 8 and we were sitting right against the bar, pressed pretty tight up against each other. But that's my only complaint. Otherwise its just fabulous!

Mayan Palace is a great little place!  Good solid Mexican food at affordable prices.  (Almost as affordable as places like Taco Burrito House but WAY tastier-although not that TB House isn't appreciated a 3am!)  The atmosphere is adorable, the tiny storefront really packs in the tables so its very cozy.  Margaritas are great!  The service is absolutely phenomenal!  I was shocked at how friendly and attentive all the staff was!  Like Rebecca T. says below, you really feel like family!

People at my work (Spacio) across the street are always ordering lunch from the Mayan Palace, so I had to check it out! Mayan Palace isn't like other mexican dive restaurants that are so common place with this kind of cuisine, if you want classy mexican come here. The one thing that struck me most about this restaurant verses other mexican cuisine venues that I've been to was the attentiveness of the staff. The server was very familiar with the menu and even was able to suggest items based on what we said we were hungry for. As for drinks the water was clean, refreshing, and plentiful, we never had to ask. The peach maragita was very smooth and had little orange peel pieces that gave it a uniqueness, and yummy tangy taste. I had the combination plate with the chile relleno (edible from tip to stem), cheese enchilada (heavy mole, smoky sauce, yum), and open face taco. I can't wait to go back! They even have a "People On Yelp Love Us" sticker in the window.

This place is amazing. Every Thursday night, me and a couple of my girlfriends get together here. We enjoy the half of margaritas, queso fundido, and guacamole.  The margaritas are made with real fruit which makes them the best in the city! The service is great, the margaritas are fantastic, and the food is to die for. Everyone should try this place sometime in your life!

I had a late lunch at Mayan Palace a few days back...having tired of the much closer restaurants near my workplace. I ordered the combination #3...one taco, one enchilada and one chille relleno. I'd say I was impressed with the taco compared to many I've had, the grilled green peppers were especially tasty...though there was way too much lettuce and not enough tomatoes. The enchilada's sauce was a bit richer and smokier than I am used to, I think perhaps more "authentic' maybe even a little mol-ee, but I didn't actually like it. The Chille Relleno was very good.  Gooey cheese, tender pepper, crispy and yet flexible batter. I'd say Mayan Palace is better than a lot of taquerias but still, overall, pretty standard.

The food is very good but what keeps me going back is that the service is phenominal.  It doesn't matter who your servier is, because all of them will stop by your table to ask if you need anything.  The bartender even stops by the table to make sure you're happy with your drinks.  They really care about their restaurant.  I've seen waiters washing the windows when they are slow.

My husband and I LOVE Mayan Palace.  It is close to our house and definitely our favorite spot for Mexican.  We probably eat here an average of two or three times a month, especially in summer when their lovely covered outdoor patio is open in back, doubling the capacity of the restaurant.  We usually order the taco dinner and the tacos al pastor are a hands down favorite, although other dishes I've tried have been delicious as well.  I'm not a huge fan of refried beans, but I enjoy them here with the rice and tacos!  My husband is from El Salvador and he loves the guac, salsa and unlimited slices of lime here.  The waitstaff and manager recognize us now and are always very friendly and attentive -- and it's a  great place to practice your Spanish if you're trying to learn, like me!  Service is great, the food arrives quickly and is very tasty, drinks are well-priced (love the pina coladas!), and there is usually not a long wait for a seat.  A great place for a nice, reasonably priced meal out with friends or a date!

I've been going here almost weekly since I moved to Chicago back in 2006. Found it through a friend. It is my favorite place to get Mexican. The food is always top notch and the service is always friendly and with a smile. My favorite dishes are the shrimp fajitas and the burrito suizo.  Their guacamole is pretty good too!!  1/2 price house margaritas and pitchers on Tuesday and Thursday make dinner and unwinding at the end of the day fabulous and affordable.  I reccommend the raspberry and pineapple! I highly recommend you give this place a try if you have not done so already!!

I took my out-of-towner friend here after reading the many positive reviews on yelp. Pros: We shared a yummy and highly alcoholic (though $30!!!) pitcher of margaritas, followed by a taco (me) and enchilada (her) dinner. Both were delicious. Even on a Friday night, we were seated promptly. The staff was friendly and checked-in with us frequently during the dinner. The chips with salsa, margaritas, and dinners came out quickly. Cons: Street parking on Halsted was a bit harder than I'd like, but, hey, it WAS a Friday night after all. Food was a bit boring. Restaurant is small and people kept walking past our table to go through a closet-sized door marked "Patio."

Top notch!   Went here for dinner on a Friday night  and encountered quick seating, great service and a spectacular meal.  Started with the large House margarita pitcher and some chips/salsa/guacamole and they were nothing short of great!    We each had a different dish---chicken burrito, awesome----chicken quesadillas, killer----chicken ranchero, a bit spicy, but still a good bet.   Our server and bussers were terrific, very attentive and friendly.   A good time, a great meal.    We've been to some great Mexican places here in Chicago, and Mayan Palace sits pretty on top of that list!

Quite often I have done take out from here, so I never felt I could give a proper review. Now that I have dined there I can! This is a great little place. The food is always tasty and the margarita's are great even by the pitcher. It is a tiny but quaintly decorated place and I know on the weekends it can get pretty busy. Service was good, friendly and prompt. The prices are sensible. It is a solid fun place to go with a few friends and a have some fun!

Tonight I met up with some friends to grab dinner....we were in the area of Mayan Palace and decided to give it a try.  I have to tell you the service was incredible!  Really outstanding.  When we arrived we were greeted and seated.  As you would expect we were given water, salsa and chips (with a smile).  A minute later our waiter came up and greeted us and gave us our menus (with a smile).  After telling us what the special was we decided on one sangria and two mojitos along with some queso fundito.  A few minutes later our drinks were delivered with our appetizer (and a smile).  The drinks were really big....pint glasses...only $4....and quite strong.  The queso was very delicious and had a garnish of fresh thinly sliced jalapeno pepper (yum).  A few minutes later we ordered our food from our (smiling) waiter.  ***as an aside, our water glasses were continuously filled throughout the meal***  When our food arrived (with a smile) everyone was very pleased...even my picky friend.  I ordered the Mayan Chimichanga and it was very good.  The ambiance was very warm and inviting and there was a significant crowd of people dining there for a stormy summer night.  It was obvious many of them were regulars as they knew the friendly staff.  The main reason I am giving Mayan Palace five stars is because of their amazing service.  I did think the food was very good, but the service (with a smile) made my night.  I will definitely go back!

I'm not sure what crack these other reviewers are smoking, but Mayan Palace is not worth four or five stars. I went here with some friends who were VERY hungry. We were a little bummed we couldn't smoke outside, but we sat out on the patio anyway. The service seemed very nice, I will give them that. Kim and I ordered some tasty margaritas (which she downed in like five minutes!) Those were pretty good--no complaints there. The chips and salsa were fine, but the salsa was a little spicy for my taste buds. I decided to take a chance on the veggie enchiladas. What a disaster! Okay, so it wasn't THAT bad, but I was quite disappointed in the canned mushrooms. Who in the hell uses canned effing mushrooms??!! Seriously! I guess everyone else had good food. THEN...the check took forever! We sat there for at least 15-25 minutes. Also, when we took a little bathroom break, my friend said it seemed as though they were talking about us. WTF? We were good little patrons, nothing but polite. So, enter at your own risk, I guess.

What an unsuspecting winner!  The food was amazing, but what pushed it over the top was the unbelievable service - so attentive and caring.  We felt like family. Also, we sat out back in the patio which was perfect - I never realized they had one.  I will definitely go back! Gracias!!!  :)

When I crave really good mexican, this is where I go. My boyfriend loves this place too and he's hispanic. The restaurant is tiny but we've always made reservations even though there has never been a wait. Cute small outdoor deck in the back. Guacamole was super fresh, portions are huge, margaritas are strong. Their skirt steak is delicious, soo tender and juicy. Prices are so reasonable and you'll always end up having leftovers. Another great yelp recommendation!

This is some very good, authentic mexican food.  I had no idea that this place had such a huge following, but I echo all the positive comments made here...and be careful about the margaritas because they are really really strong

We came here for my birthday... on the day... of the Gay Pride Parade. BOY was THAT an experience!! We enjoyed the parade through the open windows. Hahaha! Anyway, the waiter we had was so friendly and helpful, I loved it. The chips were good ... we kept eating them because we had no idea what we wanted to order. They're the kind I would peg as authentic, even though I'm not Hispanic. The table shared a pitcher of mango-strawberry margarita, and it was strong, but delicious! Nothing I could make could compare. (Wait, does it sound like I make a lot of drinks...?) We all ordered something different, and it all tasted great. The plates are humongous! After the entree, there is no room for dessert, so if you come, try to conserve some of that space to try a dessert! I would love to hear about the desserts here! PS - I noticed the Yelp sticker on the door, too!!
Good margarita specials and the owner Rudy is really nice!  Also, try the tortilla soup!

Mmmmayan Palace. Good stuff. I finally got around to trying out Mayan Palace this Sunday night and am so glad I did. The restaurant itself is really cute and rustic looking. The service was excellent. We were greeted and seated as soon as we walked in. Throughout the night it almost seemed like we had 3 waiters. Our main waiter and two other waiters that would come around to see if we wanted refills on chips or drinks. It was great.  Onto to the food...the chips I thought were a bit on the hard side but the guac was really tasty and fresh. I ordered the tortilla soup and ooohoohoohooo it was so good! Wish they would of used the chips from the soup as their dipping chips. The soup had corn, chicken, black beans, cilantro...man it was good. I ordered a combination platter. Tamale, carne asada taco and a chile relleno. Tamale was a bit on the dry side so I probably wouldn't order that again but the chile relleno and carne asada taco were really yummy.  Drinks I had a mojito...not very impressed but I've yet to find a place that makes a mojito better than La Fonda. The sangria on the other hand was very good...would definitely order that again.  Didn't have room for dessert unfortunately but we will be back! Next time I want to sit in the back patio which we checked out before we left. Good times!

GO ON TUES OR THURSDAY, bottom line. it's half price margaritas on these days. the staff is extremely friendly, the food is actually really good and inexpensive, and the margaritas are not bad for the price. the margaritas are not fancy and if you know your tequila, i don't recommend them. however if you want a strong, powerful, and cheap margarita... go here on a tuesday or thursday! the burritos are great and so are the salads... in the summer they have a nice backdoor patio as well, i suggest going there. the winter time fills up on tuesday and thursday, just a warning. check this place out

Me and a buddy of mine were hungover this Sunday evening and had a serious craving for some comfort Mexican food full of cheesy goodness. I suggested we try out Las Palmas but ruled it out do to the price. We didn't feel like paying over $20 per entree for hangover food.  After driving all over town looking for a good Mexican joint we finally settled on Mayan Palace after driving by it. It looked welcoming and was next to one of my favorite Italian restos, Sappori Tratoria. I wasn't sure what to expect but both me and my friend left very impressed and will definitely go back again. The food was exaclt what we were looking for. The salsa was good, however the chips could have been better, i.e saltier. We ordered spinach quesadilla as an appetizer and the chimichangas for our entrees with a chili relleno as a side item and some queso dip for some comfort.  The food was very good and hit the spot. It was perfect hangover food. Clean environment, nice decor for a Mom and Pop joint and extremely friendly staff/ Our waiter, Alex, was awesome! He was one of the best waiters I've had in along time. He treated us as if we were VIPs. When we left he asked us our names and said he would try to remember it when we return. How many waiters give you that kind of personalized attention these days?! Because he gave us such excellent customer service, we thought he might have been the owner but he wasn't. He said he just started working there within the past year.  I will definitely be hitting this place often in the future. If you go ask for Alex as your server. Also, an FYI, they have half price margaritas on Tuesdays and Thursdays. Hope this helps.

Normally I don't like the rice thats on the sides in Mexican dishes but the rice here was good. I really enjoyed it. The chimichanga was good too, but nothing spectacular. What was great was the sangria. It had fresh cut apples and strawberries and the wine wasn't too sweet. Id definitely recommend  it for middle of the day debauchery before returning to work.

The food was unbelievable!  The guacamole was absolutely delicious, fresh and authentic!  The salsa was fantastic and laced with fresh cilantro - I suppose some people might find it a little "hot" but it was perfect for me.   My brother ordered the enchiladas.  He thought it had a nice sauce and lots of flavor (and he normally doesn't order enchiladas - so he was a bit nervous).  We raved to our waiter Alejandro.  He was extremely helpful and knowledgeable about our choices.  In fact, everyone there was extremely enthusiastic.  And for anyone that is a vegetarian: the chips are deep fried in vegetable oil!

What else can I say that hasn't already been said? Great food, nothing fancy, fantastic margaritas, all for very reasonable prices. Service is terrific, too. "Our waiter" remembered the GF and I after we hadn't been there for many weeks, and he commented that it "had been a while." It can get a little busy (read: crowded, loud, and you might be in for a wait), but it's what a neighborhood Mexican restaurant should be.

Excellent Mexican food.  The best I've had in Chicago.  The service is excellent (all the waiters are friendly).  I went there 2x in one week.  The rice is great (I love Meixcan rice) and the guacamole is yummy.   On Tuesdays and Thursdays, margaritas are 1/2 off.  They have a variety of frozen flavors, although the original margarita is quite good.  Try the fish tacos--you won't be sorry.  Everything on the menu is great, and comes in large portions.  It gets busy around 7 or 8 on the weekends, but if you come in small parties, you can usually get seated.  They also have an outdoor patio when it's nice outside.  I love this place!!
My new favorite mexican restaurant in chi.  Awesome margaritas and great food.  I was not disappointed.  Ask for Alejandro!

I would have given this place 5 stars had the waitress not messed up our Margarita order and given us the wrong check. Thankfully, our friend pushed the waitress who was unwilling at first to switch the margarita to provide us with the right one.  I mean, we know what we ordered. This place has 1/2 price margaritas on Tues/Thurs. (a steal)..  If you come here on a Thurs, make sure to come by 6. we came shortly after, and had just beat the mad rush... and the restaurant is pretty small.  We had a large pitcher of mango margarita (frozen) for $13 - normally priced at $26 per pitcher.  A large pitcher would probably allow each person 1.5 glasses - which is pretty good if you're not looking to get plastered :). The chips & salsa (free) are really good.. we also ordered the guac and chips which were good as well for apps.  For dinner, I had the carne asada for around $13 - MmmM MMm Mm. I'm not a big fan of Mexican food, but it was cooked extremely well - not too dry, not too rare, tasty, the beans and rice were so good.  I also picked at a friend's fajitas - which were really good, and the super burrito was huge and tasty. Overall, with the app, entree, and pitcher, I ended up paying $22.. which was pretty good for a delicious meal. I'd definitely come back here.

taco salad and margaritas.... delicious- came here sat. with my good friend kristin c for a margarita.... this quickly turned into lets get a pitcher and hang.  later on we decided that we should have dinner... I love a taco salad, and although there was lots of meat in it, it was mighty delicious.... and not too bad on the wallet either. thank you mayan palace...  solid mexican food!  delicious margarita and great service!

Great food, great price and great service. I travelled a long way to try this little hole in the wall and it was well worth it. I will definitely be going back. By far the best service I've ever had. Make sure to try the shrimp, they're amazing!

This place is a great local Mexican restaurant, and in my opinion a step above larger places like Julio's Hacienda. The chips and salsa are great, and I find myself ordering and re-ordering the chicken flautas and pork tamales over and over again. I'd like to try other things on the menu, except I love my regular items so much! The service is extremely attentive, almost on the "too much attention" side.  But I'd rather have too much service than not enough. They don't deliver but do accommodate carry-out orders (which I  do often on the way home from work).

I had been wanting to try this place for awhile after reading all the positive reviews here and I wasn't disappointed.   My margarita was delicious (and strong) and the server was very nice about making my pregnant friend a virgin margarita (he even suggested getting a flavored margarita to her since the traditional would have been pretty sour). I had the #1 combo which included a taco, tostada, and a cheese enchilada.  The taco and tostada were outstanding, the enchilada was pretty good, although I may have just been too full from the rest of the food by the time I got there. I will be back to try the patio in the summer.

Being 100% not Mexican, sometimes it takes me a while to explore the menu and get a good feel for its authenticity.  I have been to the Palace several times and tried most everything.  The margaritas are a great complement to the enchiladas and the spicy, cilantro-y salsa is a great complement to the wonderful hospitality.  Be sure to check out the patio out back in the summer.  In all, be prepared for great Mexican.

I love Mayan Palace.  Alejandro is the best waiter...ever.  Their half price margaritas Tuesdays and Thursdays are a great deal, and the food is good, seems fresh, and cheap.  A $4.95 veggie burrito?? HECK YES! It does get crowded on those half price nights, but it's cozy. There's not much to say about Mayan except that it's great, standard Mexican fare.

This is an amazing little place!  We also had Alejandro as our server and all I can say is that we left him a 100% tip!  He was awesome, the food was great, and 1/2 price margritas to boot!  This was an awesome night out and we will be sure to return.  This place is also cheep!!  Two of us left a little tipsy and stuffed full for $20!  (I have to admit that I had a  restaurant.com  coupon for $10 and they comped 2 drinks for us doing a little table hopping.)  I can't wait to go back!

Our experience can be summed up in one word... Alejandro. His hospitality and warmth made the trip worth while. He even mentioned his wonderful daughters during our dinner, and we felt as if we were part of his family when we left. We will be back for sure, not just for Alejandro, but for the food and the margaritas. We had two pitchers of margaritas, one was Jamaican Flower, and the other was a mango strawberry mix, I think both were amazing, and got us a little drunk. The food was top notch, had the guacamole and chips for an appeitizer. If you get a chance to go, make sure you go to a table where Alejandro is waiting on you.

mmmmm.  nachos!  do yourself a favor and order the nachos supreme with shredded chicken.  and the queso fundido.  and a huge pitcher of the raspberry margaritas.  put all of those things together and you have yourself a fantasically tasty night.   (apparently the burritos are pretty good too.  but i cannot get past the nachos, myself)

Good attention to detail and friendly customer service Alejandro was my waiter.  I hate cilantro ( ihatecilantro.com ).  He hooked me up with extra avocado because the guac has lots of the nasty herb.   Tuesday and Thursday they serve up half price house margaritas (something like 8+ flavors frozen or on ROCKS).  Wednesday is mojito day. Food is top notch for the price.

Loses one star because my personal mexican favorite, the cheese enchilada, was not something I would order again.  But oh boy, everything else was tasty.   Here's what I ate that I would recommend to anyone: tostada and taco (with ground beef that was pure joy).  Cheese quesadillas.  A taste of a tamale (just like my grandma used to make!  Good stuff!).  A taste of guacamole. Delicious.  And deliciously cheap.  I can imagine I'll be back...

The restaurant is teeny-tiny so make sure you call ahead for a reservation.  We had some table shuffling confusion when we first arrived, but the staff was very apologetic and even gave us a free order of guacamole for the hassle.  Awesome guacamole!!!   Great food at a decent price.

The food is excellent, and the margaritas are STRONG - just the way I like 'em. Seriously, after one I'm buzzed and 2 I'm damn near wasted. On Tuesdays and Thursday, margs are half price - great for a night out with the gang. My only complaint is that the staff is sometimes too attentive - every five minutes a waiter stops by to see how we're doing. It's pretty annoying, but I guess it's better than being ignored all night!

Woo-hoo!  Finally a solid place for Mexican fare.  Prompt service and  friendly staff.  A big draw for me was the margarita.  As a dedicated fan of this Tequliarific beverage, a solid Mexican dining experience needs to deliver on drinks.  Mayan Palace does.   I like my 'ritas like I like my men -strong and not TOO sweet.  The menu is ginormous and it took me FOREVER to decide (my dinner pal was not too impressed since she decided on the Taco Salad first thing).  A last minute decision, I went with the taco - tostada - cheese enchilada combo.  A good mix with rice n' beans.  The enchilada was probably my least favorite - I think it needed some meat for flavor.  Still, I want to come back and try everything.  I think this is economically possible due to the wallet-friendly total.  Always a nice surprise!

The food is phenomenal!  Yum!  The salsa, the guacamole, the fish tacos, the burritos...all of it.  Yummy, yum, yum!!   The restaurant is very tiny though, so make sure to call ahead for reservations. Updated 5/26/07:  The Mayan Palace has a Yelp sticker on their door.  I love seeing that.  :)

Got to give the five stars to this joint...  Other than the occasional over crowding at peak times, this is a great Mexican Cuisine location. I was introduced by a friend who lives in the area and we now visit often. Summertime offers backyard seating as well. Enjoy.

I recently moved to Chicago from Memphis where I had a favorite Mexican restaurant that I would eat at nearly once a week. Now that I am living in the Windy City I have been on a search for a new favorite. And I think I have found it. My wife and I went there the other night after 10pm (they are open until 11pm Sunday-Thursday and midnight Friday-Saturday). Upon sitting down, we were offered the standard chips and salsa (Warning: the salsa has a bit of spice to it.) We also ordered guacamole as an appetizer which was not only quite tasty but plentiful. For the main meal, I got the Steak Enchilada Supreme which comes with rice and beans. Like the salsa, the dish here had a little spice to it. And while certainly not overpowering by any means, it might be a little too much for those who like their dishes mild. Myself, I like the little kick and the meal was quite delicious. Also, the dish was clearly served with very fresh ingredients. As for the restaurant itself, the place was small but charming and relaxed. And the service was very prompt and generous. I am definitely looking forward to future visits.

mole enchiladas and strawberry-banana margaritas...enough said.  it was a ton of food and the margaritas were perfect...one could definitely detect the tequila and i liked the bits of strawberry and banana in the bottom of my glass.  it was like dessert!

Service is prompt and friendly, the food was very good (maybe an 8 out of 10 with yummy complimentary chips and salsa), and the margaritas are fantastic.   There's a new patio out back which is a very sweet, romantic place spend a dinner with your best friend and her fiance.  I wouldn't mind being a third wheel here again...

Unassuming place on Halsted with a patio in the back. Of the five or six times I've been there, the food was less than excellent only once. Unfortunately, it wasn't even very good, or this would be a five star-er. I chalked it up to bad luck and will definitely be back.

I was hungry for some Mexican food and took advice from some other reviews on Yelp.  I thought the food was very good and would definitely come back., I had the enchiladas and would definitely recommend them.  The warning about the strong margaritas is spot on, I had two of them and definitely left with a good buzz.

This is a great neighborhood mexican place.  Friendly staff, decent prices, good food, great margaritas, and the hidden outdoor patio makes you forget you are in Chicago... even before you have a pitcher of margaritas.

I too went to the Mayan Palace as recommended by Yelpers. I wasn't disappointed at all. It didn't hurt that it was around 3pm, it was beautiful day and the sun was beaming in on us making us all warm and fuzzy. All that aside, yes, the margaritas will curl your toes! I came home after eating a marvelous chicken chimichanga with a heavy duty buzz still on. (In the middle of the day, yikes, I know...) I will go there again. The drinks, food and service were above par. Like with many places you pay WAY more for the drink (i.e. margarita $9, chimichanga $6.75) The patio is open for the summer if you that tickles your fancy.

This is our FAVORITE Mexican place ever and it's located around the corner from us!!!! It has the best margaritas and salsa!!!  If you haven't tried the Jamacian Flower, give it a try.  It is excellent!  Their food is the best.....although I think their fajita's are worst item on the menu.  I really can't recommend this place enough.  I don't think it gets the credit and recognition is deserves!  And it deserves a lot!

Being 100% Mexican, I am VERY particular when it comes to Mexican food. This place does everything well! From the food to the drinks to the service....all good. My recommendation in Combo #1. Tuesdays and Thursday are 1/2 off Margaritas. Also in the back they now have an outdoor patio area. I would HIGHLY recommend this to anyone looking for a good Mexican restaurant.

I was surprised at how much I liked the Mexican food at Mayan Palace. I wasn't expecting much, but loved the seafood soup. The flan was also delicious. A bonus are their great margaritas. They have flavors from mango to tamarind and offer them half priced on Tuesdays.
true mexican delights at great prices!
It doesn't look like much when you walk up to it, but stick around - the food is excellent!  I had flautas and tasted my spouse's chiles rellenos - both were great!  One gold margarita and I was set.

Five star margaritas here.  They're strong and delicious, and if it's Tuesday or Thursday, then they're half off.  The food is top notch Mexican at very reasonable prices.   I always get the burrito.  It's quite small inside, but the patio is great for sitting despite the lack of any view at all.  They'll let you smoke outside or inside if you sit by the bar, but be ready to fend off some evil looks.

Although I really don't like the food at Mayan Palace, I still have to give them props for having the best margaritas in town.  They have half price margarita specials a couple days during the week and it is the perfect place to hang out with a couple of friends.  It is a little cramped but the service makes up for it.  Victor is the best!
